column17: Youths block the entrance to an ExxonMobil facility in Upenekang in protest over a recent termination of contract workers.

column7: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
column17: PENGASSAN workers continue a protest for a second day.

Supporters of the All Progressives Congress party, APC, in Rivers demonstrate in Port Harcourt, protesting what they termed killings of their members, harassment and blackmailing of the security agencies by the Rivers state Governor, Nyesom Wike and the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, particularly during a recent election. The protest was led by Rivers State Governor, Nyesom Wike.
Inmates of the Abakaliki prison riot over a marijuana ban.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: ""In the past week"" (reference made on 21/12) military forces raid areas on the Sambisa Forest, rescuing over 1,880 civilians being held by Boko Haram and arrest ""hundreds"" of insurgents. At least 21 of those rescued are believed to be of the ""Chibok Girls.""

Eighteen people are feared killed and many others missing in a violent clash between Tivs and Fulanis in Sabon Gidan village of Dan Anacha town in Gassol Local Council of Taraba State. Sources from the area said the crisis started at the weekend when two bodies of Fulani were found killed in a bush, perpetrators not known. This triggered alleged reprisal attacks on Tivs. 10,000 or more were displaced as result of the fighting.

Eighteen people are feared killed and many others missing in a violent clash between Tivs and Fulanis in Sabon Gidan village of Dan Anacha town in Gassol Local Council of Taraba State. Sources from the area said the crisis started at the weekend when two bodies of Fulani were found killed in a bush. This triggered alleged reprisal attacks on Tivs. The Daily Independent counts the dead at 24. A later breaking report from This Day counts the dead at 31.
Masked gunmen killed two people and took a member of the PDP hostage from his home in Omoku town.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers were on Sunday night killed as their weapon went off as they attempted to invade Maiduguri at Muna garage. Several nearby residents were reported injured.
Shoppers protest the closure of a shopping complex during renovation.
Staff of Abia State Polytechnic block the entrances of the school in protest over salary issues.
Youths protest against frequent violence in the area. After becoming unruly, police fired teargas into the crowd and imposed a curfew.

Traffic on the Abuja-Lokoja-Okene road was disrupted as hundreds of truck drivers used their vehicles to block the road in a protest over heavy travel taxes. The protest took place in the Kogi State portion of highway.

column7: NASUGG: National Support Groups for Good Governance
column17: NASUGG protests recent electoral violence. At the same time Abuja residents protest a prolonged power outage in their area.

After least 12 children were killed when a pickup van accidentally (believed) ran into a procession of students marking the birthday of Prophet Muhammad in Malam Sidi, a mob attacked and killed the driver.
Workers of Arik Airline under the NLC hold a one day strike and protest over labour issues.

Hundreds of youths protesting the frequent attacks and killings in Southern Kaduna communities, pelted the convoy of the Kaduna State Governor, Mallam Nasir el-Rufai, with stones. The mob also set the residence of the Caretaker Chairman of Jamaa Local Government Area ablaze. A similar protest took place in the area the previous day.
Pensioners protest in Owerri over non-payment of arrears.
Youths protest in Minna over poor electrical supply to their area.

In the week of 21 December 2016, unidentified gunmen attacked civilians in Uratta Umuoha community (Isiala-Ngwa South, Abia). No fatalities and/or injuries reported but a local armed group later clashed with these gunmen (coded separately).
In the week of 21 December 2016, unidentified gunmen clashed with a local armed group in Uratta Umuoha community (Isiala-Ngwa South, Abia). The militia arrested one, while one escaped.
1,400 graduates recruited by Zamfara state government demonstrated at the State House of Assembly to protest non-payment of their salaries.

One person was feared dead in Ado Ekiti during a protest by traders who were protesting what they called disturbance by the officials of a taskforce of the Ekiti State Ministry of Works. It was also gathered that the Commissioner for Works narrowly escaped being lynched as the protesters.
The traditional monarch of Agbarha Kingdom, Delta State is kidnapped while travelling in Ndokwa East.
Between 1-2 police officers killed, with others injured or abducted in an attack by an unidentified armed group in Oye.

column7: CCCSO: Coalition of Concerned Civil Society Organisation
column17: Members of CCCSO protest, calling on the Attorney General of the Federation and Minster of Justice to investigate and prosecute perpetrators of killings that took place during a recent poll. A similar protest took place in the city two days ago.
Youths in Mangu staged a protest over harassment by security forces.
The Taraba State secretariat complex was ""shut down"" by civil servants who were protesting against the non-payment and irregularities in the payment of salaries and pensions.

Workers of the Ondo State government ""dragged"" the state Account General to a bank to force him to withdrawal their unpaid salaries after they had picketed his office in the Alagbaka, Akure. No injuries reported on the behalf of the Accountant General.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces capture a Boko Haram stronghold in Smabisa Forest known as ""Camp Zero,"" at Parisu causing enemy fighters to flee. Arrests reported, including a French citizen. No violence reported. Muhammadu Buhari says Camp Zero was one on the last Boko Haram strongholds in the area, claiming they have been ""technically defeated.""
Around 23 December 2016, IS West Africa militants attacked and killed 4 Nigerian soldiers and seized two vehicles, weapons and ammunitions in Yobe.

Unidentified gunmen suspected to be members of a ""cult group"" have killed no fewer than eight people in Omoku in Ogba/Egbema/Ndoni Local Government Area. The attack, believed to be political, comes following a re-run election in the area.
Fulanis attack Goska, near Kafanchan over two days, killing eleven.
The corpse of a Fulani is discovered in Emu-Ebendo ""over the Christmas weekend.""
Fulanis attack Goska, near Kafanchan over two days, killing eleven.
A prominent APC member is assaulted while fraternising with other APC supporters in Dampar ward. Perpetrator not known.
Protest of bus operators in Benin City after a fellow driver is killed by a suspected street gang.
On 25 December 2016, unidentified gunmen attacked civilians in the Uratta Umuoha community (Isiala-Ngwa South, Abia). This follows clashes days before with a communal militia in the same place.
After attacking the previous week, unidentified gunmen regroup and again attack Uratta Umuoha, killing three.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 26 December 2016, 2 Boko Haram suicide bombers were foiled after they are stopped by a local armed group in Maiduguri (Maiduguri, Borno). The first bomber detonated a bomb pack, killing only herself. Following the first explosion the militia physically attacked the second bomber. The bombers pack was later reported detonated. Two deaths total.
Unidentified assailants attack and kill three police officers in Idu.
Protesters barricade an expressway after two are killed in an auto accident.
The convoy of an APC chieftain is attacked in Mala village, Ibi LGA. One dead, three injured. One of the injured was assaulted days earlier in Dampar ward.
Protest in Sapele over a prolonged power outage.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Hunters clash with Boko Haram at Karetu ""a week ago"" (source dated 06/01). Fifteen of the hunters were reported dead, five of whom were beheaded, after their remains were found between Gubio and Mobbar Local Government Areas.

Sources said the armed mercenaries numbering more than 50 allegedly released by Ikot-Offiong village have in the ""past three days"" terrorised the riverine villages of Oku Iboku with 10 people feared killed, many kidnapped and more than 100 houses burnt. Other villages in the area of Oku affected by the attacks were Obot Oku, Ikot Etim Ama, Ufak Oku Iboku, Esen Ikot Esia, Esik Essien, Nta Ikan, Oku Iboku and Bokondo among other 11 coastal villages in the area.

Sources said the armed mercenaries numbering more than 50 allegedly released by Ikot-Offiong village have in the ""past three days"" terrorised the riverine villages of Oku Iboku with 10 people feared killed, many kidnapped and more than 100 houses burnt. Other villages in the area of Oku affected by the attacks were Obot Oku, Ikot Etim Ama, Ufak Oku Iboku, Esen Ikot Esia, Esik Essien, Nta Ikan, Oku Iboku and Bokondo among other 11 coastal villages in the area.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On December 30, 2016 at about 1330hrs, the troops arrested a confirmed Boko Haram member at Goni Kalla. While the suspect was being moved from Goni Kalla to Damaturu, the Boko Haram member attempted to escape by jumping out of the vehicle. He was therefore shot and killed.

Sources said the armed mercenaries numbering more than 50 allegedly released by Ikot-Offiong village have in the ""past three days"" terrorised the riverine villages of Oku Iboku with 10 people feared killed, many kidnapped and more than 100 houses burnt. Other villages in the area of Oku affected by the attacks were Obot Oku, Ikot Etim Ama, Ufak Oku Iboku, Esen Ikot Esia, Esik Essien, Nta Ikan, Oku Iboku and Bokondo among other 11 coastal villages in the area.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks military forces at Rann, leading to a three hour battle. Fifteen Boko Haram dead.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Arrests: Security forces capture 1,400 suspects between 28 December, 2016 and 4 January, 2017 ""at the fringes of Sambisa forest.""

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate a pack at a market late into the evening, killing herself and injuring one other.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill three and injure others in Ikorodu.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Detonation: A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated a pack at a customs area in Maiduguri, killing or injuring only herself.
Two protesters are shot and killed by police outside the Chi Limited Corp.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces carry out a bombardment on [the Boko Haram areas of] Adzunge, Gombole, Malabi, Sowolowo, Izuwe, Ngwalimiri (Gwaramiri) and Latan villages. It is not clear if this was an artillery or air attack. Causalities not known.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 15 hunters were beheaded by Boko Haram in Gubio LGA.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces carry out a bombardment on [the Boko Haram areas of] Adzunge, Gombole, Malabi, Sowolowo, Izuwe, Ngwalimiri (Gwaramiri) and Latan villages. It is not clear if this was an artillery or air attack. Causalities not known.

column17: Military forces embarked on clearance operation to Dumur forest in continuation with Operation Rescue Finale. The troops cleared Dumur and Bula Julta. No violence reported.

column17: Military forces carry out a bombardment on [the Boko Haram areas of] Adzunge, Gombole, Malabi, Sowolowo, Izuwe, Ngwalimiri (Gwaramiri) and Latan villages. It is not clear if this was an artillery or air attack. Causalities not known.
PDP staff protest a seven month long shut out of their headquarters at Wadata Plaza.

column7: NARD: National Association of Resident Doctors; Health Workers (Nigeria)
column17: NARD doctors protest in Yaba on 03/01.

column9: Urhobo Ethnic Group (Nigeria); Isoko Ethnic Group (Nigeria)
column17: Two indigenes of Urhobo and Isoko ethnic nationalities in Delta State were abducted at Aladja, Udu Local Government Area of the state by suspected ""ethnic warlords.""
5 suspected cultists were killed by the Army in a deadly encounter between the gang and some soldiers.
Fulanis and Idoma militias clash in Okpale Ogege, five deaths reported.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Soldiers repelled an early morning Boko Haram attack on Dar village, Madagali LGA. No casualties reported from the military side.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces, along with a local civilian militia group, gun down three would be suicide bombers as they attempted to ender Madagali's Gulak market.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigerian troops have killed three would-be Boko Haram suicide bombers, when they tried to ram into troops along Dutse, Ngoshe in Gwoza area of the state.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On January 5, 2017 at about 0745hrs, troops conducted clearance operation along DAMASAK - GASHIGAR road. The troops successfully cleared DUOMA, ASAGA, GASHIGAR and other surrounding villages. At ASAGA(r) village, [military forces] encountered and dislodged some BHT elements. Causalities not known.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On January 5, 2017, troops conducted clearance operation along DAMASAK - GASHIGAR road. The troops successfully cleared DUOMA, ASAGA, GASHIGAR and other surrounding villages - no violence reported. At ASAGA village, [military forces] encountered and dislodged some BHT elements. Causalities not known.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On January 5, 2017, troops conducted clearance operation along DAMASAK - GASHIGAR road. The troops successfully cleared DUOMA, ASAGA, GASHIGAR and other surrounding villages - no violence reported. At ASAGA village, [military forces] encountered and dislodged some BHT elements. Causalities not known.
Two brothers are killed by Fulani attackers in Urhoha Abraka, Ethiope East.
Pensioners protested a refusal of the state government to pay them several months of pension arrears in Owerri.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Arrests: The Nigerian Army said it had arrested about 963 persons suspected to be Boko Haram during an operation between Jan. 4 and Jan.9.

Urhobo gunmen shot and beheaded an indigene of Isaba, an Ijaw community in Warri South-West Local Government Area, Delta State. One person was injured and one missing in an ensuing shootout between the invaders, suspected to be from a neighbouring Urhobo community and youths of Isaba.
Two Fulani herdsmen were killed by unknown persons from a neighbouring area in Umuoba-Anam. It was reported that the incident happened while the herders were grazing their cattle in the area.
CAN protests at Port Harcourt city council over recent killings in southern Kaduna State.
A boundary dispute between Erhiephihor community (in Udu council area) and their neighbouring Edjophe community (Ughelli South council area) led to the death of one.
Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen killed 2 people in renewed attacks near Kagoro.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Five soldiers, including a captain were killed Saturday evening in an evening attack launched by suspected Boko Haram militants on 27 Taskforce Brigade of the Nigeria Army in Buni Yadi, Gujba Local Government Area of Yobe State. A source reported military forces shot ""two scores"" of the attackers as they fled.
The community of Alor in Idemili South Local Government Area of Anambra State was at the weekend temporarily shut by protesters over government's 'imposition' of a caretaker committee in the area.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A senior officer and 3 others soldiers were killed when Boko haram attacked a military location near Maiduguri. The attackers were trailed to a village where one of them was found dead, probably from gunshot injuries.
3 policemen, 2 civilians and several herdsmen (assuming 10) were killed during a shootout in the Demsa villages of Kwahine, Gidan Dadi and Karlahi.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: No fewer than 67 Boko Haram fighters were shot dead by troops in the latest gun battle in Metele, Wulge and Bulakesa villages of Borno State, which also claimed the lives of six soldiers. The military forces were able to clear the area of Boko Haram. One reports holds six Boko Haram in Metele. Additionally, the soldiers cleared areas from DOGON CHUKU [to] TUMBUN RAGO.
Suspected herdsmen kill two farmers on their land in Ethiope East LGA. The attack is related to violence in Ukwuani LGA.
""Suspected herdsmen"" kill three herdsmen kill three on their farm in Ukwuani LGA. The violence is related to that in Ethiope East.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three male Boko Haram suicide bombers shot sporadically and attempted to infiltrate Maiduguri via Garki Muna village close to a military checkpoint when the improvised explosive device (IED) strapped to their bodies exploded, killing all of them and a member of Civilian JTF.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: No fewer than 67 Boko Haram fighters were shot dead by troops in the latest gun battle in Metele, Wulge, Manawasi, Garel and Bulakesa villages of Borno State, which also claimed the lives of six soldiers. The military forces were able to clear the area of Boko Haram. One reports holds six Boko Haram in Metele. Additionally, the soldiers cleared areas from DOGON CHUKU [to] TUMBUN RAGO.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four persons, including two Boko Haram suicide bombers died in a suicide attack at Kaleri area of Gwange in Maiduguri.
A 19-year-old student was killed in Angwa Umadi Village in Shiroro local government area of the state Saturday night by suspected cattle rustlers - identity not known.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacked Cinki Gundu, near Monguno, killing an officer and six soldiers. Eight others injured.
Protest marking the 1,000-day anniversary of the abduction of the ""Chibok Girls."" The protesters demanded more effort by the government to retrieve them.

Two police officers are killed in a clash with Fulani in Demsa LGA. The clash comes after a series of Fulani attacks on civilian populations of Kwayine, GidanDadi and Karlahi. Date(s) not known. Sources dated 10/01, though alludes to the fact that the attacks happened at least 24 hours [before then]."" Civilian causalities not known.
Students of Ladoke Akintola University of Technology (LAUTECH) protested closure of the institution in the last eight months. The protesters barricaded the entrances to Mokola Roundabout.

Two police officers are killed in a clash with Fulani in Demsa LGA. The clash comes after a series of Fulani attacks on civilian populations of Kwayine, GidanDadi and Karlahi. Date(s) not known. Sources dated 10/01, though alludes to the fact that the attacks happened at least 24 hours [before then]."" Civilian causalities not known.

Two police officers are killed in a clash with Fulani in Demsa LGA. The clash comes after a series of Fulani attacks on civilian populations of Kwayine, GidanDadi and Karlahi. Date(s) not known. Sources dated 10/01, though alludes to the fact that the attacks happened at least 24 hours [before then]."" Civilian causalities not known.
On 9 January 2017, 20 African coalition soldiers were killed in an attack by IS West Africa soldiers on their positions in the town of Buni Yadi.
A member of a local group accosts a Hause scrap dealer on 10/01. The attack lead to broader clashes later in the week.
Farmers and herders clash over access to land. Four reported dead.
Members of the JAC protest at ""various campuses"" (only Kogi State Polytechnic, Lokoja named) in the state as they protested against non payment of salaries to some of their members.

Workers at several oil flow stations in Delta State (Olomoro Flow Station, Olomoro Compressor Station, 1 and 2, Oweh Flow Station, Oroni Flow Station, Uzere Flow Station, Uzere Compressor Station, Afiesere Flow Station, Afiesere Compressor Station, Kokori Flow Station, Evwreni Flow Station and Ughelli Pumping Station) walk off the job and protest of unpaid salaries.

Residents of Odioma community in Brass Local Government Area of Bayelsa State demonstrated at the office of the Chairman of the council to protest alleged plans to relocate a Fertilizer and Petrochemical Company to another area.

Workers at several oil flow stations in Delta State (Olomoro Flow Station, Olomoro Compressor Station, 1 and 2, Oweh Flow Station, Oroni Flow Station, Uzere Flow Station, Uzere Compressor Station, Afiesere Flow Station, Afiesere Compressor Station, Kokori Flow Station, Evwreni Flow Station and Ughelli Pumping Station) walk off the job and protest of unpaid salaries.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks a group of soldiers in the Old Marte area of the city. Two dead, eight wounded.

Workers at several oil flow stations in Delta State (Olomoro Flow Station, Olomoro Compressor Station, 1 and 2, Oweh Flow Station, Oroni Flow Station, Uzere Flow Station, Uzere Compressor Station, Afiesere Flow Station, Afiesere Compressor Station, Kokori Flow Station, Evwreni Flow Station and Ughelli Pumping Station) walk off the job and protest of unpaid salaries.
Protest at the headquarters of Hydro-Drive on 17 in Apapa over a hydroelectric company's ""militarisation"" and ""marginalisation.""
Communities in Burutu Local Government Area (LGA) of Delta State protested from access to a hydroelectric plant.
On 11 January 2017, 13 Nigerian soldiers were killed and others injured in an attack by IS West Africa militants in the town of Anjini in Borno.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two soldiers are dead following a Boko Haram attack ""close to the Nigerian border [with] the Republic of Chad.""

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A Boko Haram planted IED kills two military officers - a captain and lieutenant - at Golgore River Bank in Damboa Local Government Area in central Borno State at about 11:15 am, 12/01.

Three are dead in a clash between Fulani/Hausa and a group of local residents in Etiam-Etoi. The ""trouble"" between the two group began the night of 11/01, but is believed to have escalated in the following days.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Beginning on Thursday 13th January 2017, with the assistance of some local vigilantes and civilian JTF, the troops carried out fighting patrols and clearance operations in Awada and Sinbaya villages, both of Dikwa LGA. 13 Boko Haram fatalities over two days. The soldiers also carried out similar clearance operation at Anaduwa village, where they recovered a number of hostages and equipment. Some sources claim the battle began on 12/01.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers target a checkpoint at the entrance of Madagali. Nine dead (plus bombers), 13 hospitalised. Possible new tactic to avoid detection: One of the bombers carried a baby.
A boat driver was killed by troops of the Joint Task Force (JTF) in Polaku. Reasons not known.
Igbo youths protest in Enugu to demand police apologise for raiding the Abuja home of the former first lady several months ago.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: An Improvised Explosive Device, planted by Boko Haram, detonated and killed an army captain, a lieutenant and injured a few soldiers.
Nine are killed in a Fulani attack of Sabon Ndaga, Rafin Gona and BCC Gbagyi communities of Bosso LGA.
Nine are killed in a Fulani attack of Sabon Ndaga, Rafin Gona and BCC Gbagyi communities of Bosso LGA.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack at two different location in Kangarwa. Three soldiers, ten Boko Haram dead. Conflicting sources claim the attack occurred on 14/01.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Beginning on Thursday 13th January 2017, with the assistance of some local vigilantes and civilian JTF, the troops carried out fighting patrols and clearance operations in Awada and Sinbaya villages, both of Dikwa LGA. 13 Boko Haram fatalities over two days. The soldiers also carried out similar clearance operation at Anaduwa village, where they recovered a number of hostages and equipment. Some sources claim the battle began on 12/01.

One person was shot and wounded in a gun battle on the evening of 14/01 between Ogbe-Ijoh and Aladja communities in Warri South-West and Udu Local Government Areas, Delta State. Reports from the area said the clash took place between 7.48 pm- 7.55 pm at the boundary between the two warring communities.

The beheading of a young man by a chief hunter for the burial ceremony of a high chief led to a communal clash between 2 neighbouring communities (Ogwurude and Oyida) in a local government. Ten reported dead in the clash. It is not clear which community killed the man during the burial ceremony.

The beheading of a young man by a chief hunter for the burial ceremony of a high chief led to a communal clash between 2 neighbouring communities (Ogwurude and Oyida) in a local government. Ten reported dead in the clash. It is not clear which community killed the man during the burial ceremony.

The beheading of a young man by a chief hunter for the burial ceremony of a high chief led to a communal clash between 2 neighbouring communities (Ogwurude and Oyida) in a local government. Ten reported dead in the clash. It is not clear which community killed the man during the burial ceremony.
Kogi State Polytechnic workers protest non-payment of salaries.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two members of Boko Haram kidnap and kill a young boy after he identified them to authorities.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Beginning on Thursday 13th January 2017, with the assistance of some local vigilantes and civilian JTF, the troops carried out fighting patrols and clearance operations in Awada and Sinbaya villages, both of Dikwa LGA. 13 Boko Haram fatalities over two days. The soldiers also carried out similar clearance operation at Anaduwa village, where they recovered a number of hostages and equipment. Some sources claim the battle began on 12/01.
A group of Nigerian wailers held a march in Abuja to protest against activities of Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) which they say impacts negatively on the economy.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 14 January 2017, an unidentified communal militia, along with some local hunters, clashed with Boko Haram insurgents in Sabongari village (Madagali, Adamawa), killing 7 BH members.
18 houses have been burnt and several persons wounded in a renewed clash between the Kutia and Ukpe communities in Obud Local Government Area of Cross River State.
Police shoot and kill a suspected kidnapper during an attempted abduction of a traditional ruler in Okitipupa.
A person is shot and killed by a police officer's stray bullet during a protest.

At least 11 members of the Civilian Joint Task Force (CJTF) were killed at Abaji area of Kastina Ala local government area of Benue State. Daily Trust gathered from locals in the affected area that the CJTF members were holding a meeting at Tse-Igber village in Abaji community when some gun-wielding youths who rode on a Bajaj motorcycle opened fire on them. It is not clear if the members of CJTF were armed at the time of the attack.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Six dead after suspected Boko Haram detonate two suicide explosives, first at a mosque, then second at the University of Maiduguri. Among the dead include a lecturer. Abubakar Shekau later formally declared responsibility.
Protest at a fertilizer plant over plans of privatization.

Coalition of Yoruba Youths on 16/01 entered the Lagos office of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) protesting alleged persecution and harassment of the former First Lady of Nigeria, Mrs. Patience Jonathan by the Commission in an ongoing investigation.
Fulani herdsmen killed 11 villagers when they attacked Isuku and Iseluland communities.
Fulani herdsmen killed 11 villagers when they attacked Isuku and Iseluland communities.

Staff of local government councils violently protest over the ""arbitrary removal of their names from the work force as result of the staff screening exercise."" The protesters lit fires and blocked roads.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigerian air forces strike a Boko Haram position about 1 nautical mile south of Tumbum Rego in northern Borno. Casualties not known.

column9: MHWUN: Medical and Health Workers Union of Nigeria
column17: The Chairman of Sokoto State Chapter of the Medical and Health Workers Union of Nigeria is kidnapped on 16/01.
Three people were reported killed and scores injured after unidentified gunmen attacked a ""relaxation spot"" in Zango-Kataf LGA.
A suspected gang member is lynched by a mob.

One killed, three injured as herdsmen, farmers clash in Okoti village in Odoekpe, Ogbaru Local Government Area, Anambra State. One death, three injures. The motive of the clash may have been revenge or continued conflict between the two.
Four land grabbers kill a man in Ogigo.
Four persons were feared dead and scores of persons injured in the renewed boundary crisis between Oku Iboku community in Akwa Ibom and Ikot Offiong in Cross River, along Calabar-Itu bridge.
Fulanis attack Samaru Kataf on 17/01, three reported dead.

column9: Refugees/IDPs (Nigeria); ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Nigeria)
column17: Targeting Boko Haram, air forces misfire, hitting a civilian location in Kala Balge. Estimates of the number of dead vary and the army has refused to say how many were killed. Among the dead included six red cross workers. The chairman of Kala Balge Local Government Area, where the accident occurred, Babagana Malarima, has said that his people buried 234 persons killed in the airstrike.
Property destruction: A pipeline belonging to the Niger Petroleum Development Company, NPDC, is set on fire by suspected ""oil rebels.""

Thousands of Shiite IMN members on 18/01 held protest marches in major cities across northern Nigeria to demand the release of their leader, Ibrahim El-Zakzaky. The protests took place in Kaduna, Katsina, Sokoto, and Kano as well as the Federal Capital Territory, FCT.
Two are dead in a communal clash in Azuofia-Edda community, Abakaliki. Date not clear.

Thousands of Shiite IMN members on 18/01 held protest marches in major cities across northern Nigeria to demand the release of their leader, Ibrahim El-Zakzaky. The protests took place in Kaduna, Katsina, Sokoto, and Kano as well as the Federal Capital Territory, FCT.

Thousands of Shiite IMN members on 18/01 held protest marches in major cities across northern Nigeria to demand the release of their leader, Ibrahim El-Zakzaky. The protests took place in Kaduna, Katsina, Sokoto, and Kano as well as the Federal Capital Territory, FCT.
Members of Kogi State Ministry of Health are attacked by unidentified gunmen. One death reported.
On 18 January 2017, the coordinator of Roll Back Malaria in Kogi state, his driver and 3 others were killed by gunmen on their way from an advocacy campaign in Ajaokuta. Date not clear.

A group of youths create and illegal roadblock at Samaru Kataf near Kafanchan and attack the convoy of the emir of Jama'a. The roadblock and attack were in protest of a Fulani attack on Samaru Kataf on Tuesday. The emir managed to escape, but the convoy itself was destroyed.
Protesters gather at the state high court building to demonstrate against the court proceedings of the former First Lady.

Three Ikwerre communities, Rivers State, ""last week"" (source dated 24/01), gathered at the 343 Air Defence Artillery Regiment, Adaka Boro Barracks, popularly called Elele Army Barracks in protest over alleged forceful acquisition of their land running into 500 hectares by the Nigerian military. The three communities, Elele Alimini and Obelle claim that the Nigerian military took over the land used for agriculture without negotiation.

Thousands of Shiite IMN members on 18/01 held protest marches in major cities across northern Nigeria to demand the release of their leader, Ibrahim El-Zakzaky. The protests took place in Kaduna, Katsina, Sokoto, and Kano as well as the Federal Capital Territory, FCT.

Thousands of Shiite IMN members on 18/01 held protest marches in major cities across northern Nigeria to demand the release of their leader, Ibrahim El-Zakzaky. The protests took place in Kaduna, Katsina, Sokoto, and Kano as well as the Federal Capital Territory, FCT.

column7: KAROTA: Kano Road and Traffic Agency
column9: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Members of the Kano Road Traffic Agency and NURTW clash over a motor park. Local police dispersed the groups.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram abducts two young boys in Maiduguri, killing one three days later after their father could not pay them they money they demanded.

A motorcycle operator, an indigene of Obubra community in was killed by youths of Azuofia- Edda community. Both communities have been engaged in endless land dispute since 1984. Date of attack not clear.
Gunmen kill a community leader and his Togolese companion in Ijegun. Date not clear.
Three males were shot dead in Samarun Kataf, Zangon Kataf by Fulani herdsmen who rode on motorcycles
One person was killed when the people of Isaba and Ogbe-Ijoh attacked Aladja community. It was reported that another person was severely injured in the attack.
Police say at least six people have been killed in communal violence between Fulani and Mumuye ethnic groups. Six reported dead, over 80 houses burned over five days.
Police reportedly dispersed a pro-US President Trump demonstration led by the IPOB. 65 arrests reported. Reports of 11 protesters killed.

column7: PMWOB: Patriotic Mothers Without Borders; Women (Nigeria)
column17: The group known as 'Patriotic Mothers Without Borders' protested at the Abuja headquarters of EFCC on Friday calling for the arrest of a PDP chairman for alleged involvement in a $2.1 billion arms deal.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Around 15 Boko Haram fighters were killed when the jihadists attacked a town in northeastern Nigeria, two days after the air force accidentally killed hundreds of people. Date not clear, event may have occurred on 19/01.
Unidentified gunmen attack and kill five in Ajaokuta. A similar attack against state government officials occurred in the area two days earlier.
Police say at least six people have been killed in communal violence between Fulani and Mumuye ethnic groups. Six reported dead, over 80 houses burned over five days.

Students of the Osun State University, Osogbo, protested the shooting of two of their colleagues by some policemen. The protesting students lit bon fires on major streets and impeded human and vehicular traffic within Osogbo metropolis. The police may have been attempting to extort money from the two.

Students of the Osun State University, Osogbo, protested the shooting of two of their colleagues by some policemen. The protesting students lit bon fires on major streets and impeded human and vehicular traffic within Osogbo metropolis. The police may have been attempting to extort money from the two.
One killed and others injured in an attack on a Fulani area on Zankan. Perpetrators not identified.

Three persons have been beheaded in the hostility between people of Azuofia Edda Community in Abakaliki Local Government Area of Ebonyi State and Osopong Community of Obubora Local Government, Cross River State. Tensions began after a Obubura resident came to Azuofia and was killed in suspected gang activity.
Unidentified persons kill a Fulani and injure others in Riyom area.
Police say at least six people have been killed in communal violence between Fulani and Mumuye ethnic groups. Six reported dead, over 80 houses burned over five days.
5 students of the College of Education, Gidan Waya, were shot dead by Fulani herdsmen who waylaid their car.

column7: NUEE: National Union of Electricity Employees; SSAEAC: Senior Staff Association of Electricity and Allied Companies; TUC: Trade Union Congress; ULC: United Labour Congress
column17: Workers of Enugu Electricity Distribution Company (EEDC,) staged a protest over the march over the alleged arbitrary sacking of staff. The protesters comprised of the United Labour Congress (ULC), Trade Union Congress, TUC, National Union of Electricity Employees (NUEE) and Senior Staff Association of Electricity and Allied Companies (SSAEAC).

column7: LPCDI: Leadership, Peace and Cultural Development Initiative
column17: A nongovernmental organisation, under the name Leadership, Peace and Cultural Development Initiative (LPCDI) made up of ex-militant leaders under the Presidential Amnesty Programme protested against the Managing Director of the Niger Delta Development Commission (NDDC), Mr. Nsima Ekere, over alleged stockpiling of funds in anticipation for his gubernatorial interest.
Fulanis attack Ajegbe village in Ohimini LGA. Farmland was reported destroyed, though no word as to the human causality. The attack led to a battle the following day.
Armed men on 22/01 attacked a Divisional Police Station at Dengi, the headquarter of Kanam local government area of Plateau State killing a police officer and carting away seven rifles.
Police say at least six people have been killed in communal violence between Fulani and Mumuye ethnic groups. Six reported dead, over 80 houses burned over five days.
Protesters barricade roads over poor electricity service.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A Policeman was killed and 7 rifles carted away when gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram sect attacked a divisional police station.
A policemen sustained gunshot injuries during a gun battle between some ""herdsmen"" and a team of policemen from the Ughelli Area Command, Delta State.
Between 10 and 15 persons were feared killed in an outbreak of fighting between suspected Fulani herdsmen and farmers at Ipiga village in Ohimini Local Government Area of Benue state.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members abducted about seven women and killed three other persons when they attacked Ndagu Village of Askira-Uba Local Government Area of Borno State.
Unknown assailants abduct and kill a man in Ipaja.
Clash between youths from neighbouring communities Ungwan Shanu and Ungwan Sarki, led to the death of two.
Unidentified persons have reportedly executed the village head and youth leader of Ikot Anta Enen Obom village, Ukanafun Local Government Area, Akwa Ibom State on 24/01.
Military forces have killed two unidentified [oil] militants in a shootout along the Obama Flow Station axis of Nembe Bayelsa East senatorial district of Bayelsa State.
A vigilante mob beats a suspected thief death at Twon Brass.
Police say at least six people have been killed in communal violence between Fulani and Mumuye ethnic groups. Six reported dead, over 80 houses burned over five days.

A communal conflict broke out between 2 neighbouring communities of Obudu in Cross River State and their Mgberedem neighbours in Kwande Local Government Area of Benue State. The land conflict led to the death of 'many people.'

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A Boko Haram suicide bomber targeted a security outpost in Usmanti, Mafa LGA but was quickly spotted and his pack was detonated after a shot from security forces. No casualty was involved except the male suicide bomber.

Residents of Ngozika Housing Estate, Awka in Awka South Local Government area of Anambra State, on 22/01, took to the streets in protest over what they termed 'exploitation and over-billing' by the Enugu Electricity Distribution Company (EEDC).
Rivers State School of Nursing students protest over dilapidated condition of infrastructure of their schools. The protest occurred ""last week"", source dated 31/01.

Boko Haram (IS supported Barnawi Faction) attacks a military base at Kamuya at 5:30 p.m. from three different directions shooting non-stop for over 30 minutes. Military forces repelled the attack. A ""large number"" of Boko Haram were said to have been killed in battle with some fleeing the scene with gunshot wounds. One source said three Nigerian soldiers died while some equipment were lost during the battle. A number of soldiers are also said to be missing.
Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN) clashed with police during a protest for the release of their detained leader, El-Zakzaky. Nine arrests.

column6: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers, a male and female, attempted to enter a Kariari mosque. They were spotted by security volunteers (Civilian JTF) who accosted them. The perpetrators detonated their explosives which killed them on the spot and one security volunteer. Two other people were injured.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers target Maiduguri during the early morning hours - one at 2am, and the other at 5. Only fatalities reported were that of the bombers. Two other injures.
Fulanis attack Ipidlo town on Okpoga, killing a woman and destroying houses.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 5 soldiers were killed during an invasion of a military camp of 'Operation Lafiya Dole' by Boko Haram in Kamuya village of Buratai ward. It was reported that the insurgents also carted away arms and ammunition. The date of the incident was not stated.
Unidentified gunmen attack Magazu village on motorcycles, kill one person.

column7: NUTGTWN: National Union of Textile Garment and Tailoring Workers of Nigeria
column17: Members of the National Union of Textile Garment and Tailoring Workers of Nigeria (NUTGTWN) picketed the corporate head office of Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company following the disconnection of two textile factories.
Suspected assassins have killed the village head of Ikot Anta Eneng Obom in Ukanafun Local Government Area of Akwa Ibom State.
Kogi State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) protest against the activities of Sen.Dino Melaye and Rep. Abiodun Faleke for ""working against the interest of the party. ""

An All progressive Congress (APC) party chieftain, Emmanuel Obuozo was assassinated in his residence in Osomini by gunmen believed to be hired assassins. It is believed the assassination is connected to the political wrangling in the state.

A 40-year-old man was shot dead in a disputed land. Two neighbouring communities, Ayede and Itaji-Ekiti have both laid claim over the disputed land for years. The killing sparked off protest by youths of Ayede, where from the victim hails.

A 40-year-old man was shot dead in a disputed land. Two neighbouring communities, Ayede and Itaji-Ekiti have both laid claim over the disputed land for years. The killing sparked off protest by youths of Ayede, from where the victim hails.

18 persons lost their lives in a communal clash between Fulani and Mummuye ethnic groups in Lushi Sakuwa, Hore Ladde and Garin Dogo villages of Lau. It was reported that the clash between the communities was started by Mummuye community.

18 persons lost their lives in a communal clash between Fulani and Mummuye ethnic groups in Lushi Sakuwa, Hore Ladde and Garin Dogo villages of Lau. It was reported that the clash between the communities was started by Mummuye community.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: More than 20 people were feared dead after Boko Haram gunmen opened fire on a convoy of motorists travelling under military escort between Maiduguri and Damboa at Korowaso forest. No reported exchange of fire between military and Boko Haram.

Members of the Ondo State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) protest against the state governor over budget proposals. The protest began on 29/01 and continued throughout the week. The protest became violent on 02/02.
An aid to the governor is shot and killed by unknown perpetrators.

The body of a man with marks of violence on his body was found in an abandoned well. It could have being that he was either killed and his corpse dumped inside the well by his attackers or he fell into the well out of desperation to escape a mob action.
Electricity consumers protest poor service in Port Harcourt, forcibly turning off the power supply.

Two persons have been killed at a communal clash between Iguomo and Ikhuenbo communities in Uhunmwode local government area of Edo State. Protests against the violence took place later in the following week, date not known.

Members of the Ondo State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) protest against the state governor over budget proposals. The protest began on 29/01 and continued throughout the week. The protest became violent on 02/02.

column6: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A Boko Haram suicide bomber killed himself and a member of the Civilian Joint Task Force. It was reported that the suicide bomber attempted to enter a housing estate.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: An 8 year-old female suicide bomber was on 30/01 detonated and killed while trying to gain access to an internally displaced persons (IDP) camp in Banki town in Borno state. No other casualty reported.
3 people were killed in a clash between farmers and Fulani herdsmen. The farmers were fishing in a pond in Gareng, Girei when they mobilised after they were attacked by the herdsmen.

Unidentified gunmen killed a UN official, 3 Nigerians, 1 Cameroonian while in the process of demarcating and delineating the Nigeria-Cameroon border in line with the judgment of the International Court of Justice.
Violent protest in Igando area of Lagos State after a Hausa man allegedly killed (likely in accident) by a commercial bus driver.
10 people were killed during a clash between 2 groups of illegal miners. The fight was over the ownership of a lucrative mining well. The date of the incident not entirely clear.

Members of the Ondo State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) protest against the state governor over budget proposals. The protest began on 29/01 and continued throughout the week. The protest became violent on 02/02.
Protest in Agbor over epileptic power supply.
Civil society groups protest in support of President Muhammadu Buhari after several other groups ""wish[ed] him dead.""
The police have arrested two persons in Ayede Ekiti, Oye Local Government Area of Ekiti State, following a violent protest which trailed an alleged murder.
Lepers stage a road blocking protest, demanding more government stipends. Fearing the disease, many area residents fled the area.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram suicide bombers attack a Maiduguri mosque. One person was killed from the explosion apart from the suicide bomber. The bomber was belied to be between 8-10 years of age.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Six members of Boko Haram and three soldiers are dead following a camp clearing battle in Damboa LGA. Locations cleared include Dulsa and Buk.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram ambush a police patrol in Biu LGA, resulting in one death. A second officer was injured.
A man was tortured to death by a vigilante group after he was accused of stealing a handset in Nyanya.

Members of the Ondo State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) protest against the state governor over budget proposals. The protest began on 29/01 and continued throughout the week. The protest became violent on 02/02.

One is killed and many others were injured when Fulani herdsmen invaded 3 villages - Tse Kyanyion, Tse Azakpa and Tse Orbiam Settlements of Logo LGA. The attackers torched several houses leading to loss of over 100 houses.
Massive protests rocked the headquarters of Transmission Company of Nigeria (TCN) in Abuja on 01/02 on what union members said was the planned removal of the Managing Director.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Six members of Boko Haram and three soldiers are dead following a camp clearing battle in Damboa LGA. Locations cleared include Dulsa and Buk.
Nurses and midwives protest in Abeokuta against the ""decay in the health sector and alleged discrimination against them by the Federal Ministry of Health.""

Members of the Ondo State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) protest against the state governor over budget proposals. The protest began on 29/01 and continued throughout the week. The protest became violent on 02/02. Several injuries reported following involvement with police.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Arrests: Military forces arrest five 'high-ranking' Boko Haram fighters (among others) at a check point in Damasak. The arrested were identified as Alhaji Madu, Abur Goni-Bukar, Ibrahim Ali, Ayuba Duse and Haruna Bukar. Among the apprehended were three Chadians.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram ambushed a police convoy at the village of Kubwa in Damboa local government area on the highway between Maiduguri-Damboa road. One death, three injures.
Sunday Jeremiah, popularly called """"Sparko"""", the PDP youth leader of ward 8 Etim Ekpo and leader of Icelander cult group was killed along side with 9 other people in rival cult clash.
Nurses at the Ahmadu Bello University Teaching Hospital (ABUTH), Zaria staged a peaceful protest blaming 'some cabals' for industrial actions by workers unions under the Federal Ministry of Health.

10 people were killed during a clash between militants (Bakassi Strike Force) and kidnappers. many of the victims are the kidnappers who were reported to be behind the series of attacks in the area that were blamed on the group. The date of the incident was not given.
Youths from Jos South crossed over to Bassa for a reprisal in which 4 people were killed between illegal miners. This event is linked to an event on 31/01.

A man was waylaid and beheaded by unidentified persons in his farm in Ayede, Oye LGA. The victim's hands were also severed from his body. It was reported that the man was killed as a result of the land dispute between Ayede-Ekiti and Itaji-Ekiti villages. This event is linked to violence in the area of 28/01. The identities of the victim/perpetrators are not known.
9 persons were killed during a communal clash between Azuofida-Edda community and Ogurude community. The crisis was caused by boundary dispute. The violence took place in Azuofida-Edda.

One person was killed while several others sustained injuries when crisis broke out during a meeting of the All Progressives Congress (APC). It was a meeting of the party candidates for their council polls.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and severely killed a police officer in Okitipupa, motive, perpetrator not known.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two people were killed by Boko Haram during an invasion on Sasawa, Damaturu. The perpetrators had earlier on attacked a military base before raiding the community where the victims were killed. Causalities of the military attack are not known.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two people were killed by Boko Haram during an invasion on Sasawa, Damaturu. The perpetrators had earlier on attacked a military base before raiding the community where the victims were killed.
A policeman was killed during a clash between Fulani herdsmen. The herdsmen were disguised in police uniform.
A vigilante mob lynches a suspected thief.
An anti-Buhari protest in Port Harcourt is barricaded by police.
Hundreds of students of the Tai Solarin University of Education (TASUED), Ijagun, Ogun State protested against ""exorbitant"" charges by the school management.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram sect members have launched attack on a military base and burnt much of Sasawa town, dislodging the soldiers and overtaking the area. Causalities not known.

""I Stand with Nigeria"" protesters, calling from a broad range of reforms, gather in Abuja, Benin, Ibadan and Lagos. It was noted the groups came in smaller number than anticipated after a celebrity endorser backed out from attending.

Violent protest in Abuja when hundreds of supporters of President Muhammadu Buhari clashed with protesters who had taken to the streets to register their anger over the government's economic policies. The anti-government protest may have been part of the ""I Stand With Nigeria"" gatherings.

""I Stand with Nigeria"" protesters, calling from a broad range of reforms, gather in Abuja, Benin, Ibadan and Lagos. It was noted the groups came in smaller number than anticipated after a celebrity endorser backed out from attending.

""""I Stand with Nigeria"""" protesters, calling from a broad range of reforms, gather in Abuja, Benin, Ibadan and Lagos. It was noted the groups came in smaller number than anticipated after a celebrity endorser backed out from attending.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) Borno Command, on 07/02 intercepted two female suicide bombers, who tried to ram into motorists at the NNPC Mega Station along Damboa Road, Maiduguri. One was shot and killed and the other was arrested. The perpetrates were believed to be with Boko Haram.
Teachers at the Federal Government Girls College, Calabar, on staged a peaceful protest to the Cross River House of Assembly over alleged assault by officers of Department of State Service (DSS).
Protests reported at the headquarters of Transmission Company of Nigeria (TCN) in Abuja on 08/02 what union members said was the planned removal of the managing director.

Youths from the coastal communities in Ondo state, on 08/02 took to the streets in Igbokoda, headquarters of Ilaje local government area of the state, protesting the non appointment of the Commissioner representing the area in the Niger Delta Development Commission (NDDC), by the federal government. The protesting youths under the auspices of Niger Delta Youth Movement(NDYM) who blocked the office of the commission as early as 9am also protested against many uncompleted projects in the area by NDDC.
Protest against communal violence that took place on 30/01. Date of protest not clear, source dated 08/02.
Three local militia members were killed by herdsmen. The attackers stormed Yan Weri and starting shooting sporadically.
Ayede youths attacked and killed a person from Itaji Ekiti over a land dispute in Orisunmbare.

Youths suspected to be pipeline vandals invaded Korokorosei Community, is the village of the Speaker of the Bayelsa State House of Assembly in Southern Ijaw Local Government Area of the state, killing one and injuring others.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Seven military forces are dead and 19 injured following a clash with Boko Haram along Ajiri-Dikwa road in in Mafa LGA. Agence France Presse reports 8 dead.
Members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN), also called Shiites, protested in Kaduna against the continuous detention of their leader, Ibraheem El-Zakzaky
Two labour unions protest at the acting president's office over the increased cost of living.

Eleven gunmen in the early hours of the day abducted the Secretary of the Isheri North Estate, GRA, Lagos at his residence in the estate. According to residents of the estate, the gunmen reportedly opened fire, shooting into the air for four hours before taking him away. Three of the estate's security officers were killed as they tried to prevent the gunmen from taking Adekoya with them.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A man was killed by Boko Haram fighters during an attack on Chibok. A 5-year-old boy was abducted during the raid. Another source reported that the victim was an Islamic scholar.

A senior lecturer with the Taraba State Polytechnic was killed by kidnappers who abducted him with a second lecturer in the night. It was reported that the kidnappers, who were 8 in number, stormed the lecturers' quarter and seized the duo.
Two persons lost their lives during a communal clash involving Iguomo and Ikhuenbo communities. The two victims were from Iguomo. Six others, including a policeman, sustained bullet wounds.
Members of civil society groups and celebrities protested in Lagos and Abuja over the ""current economic hardship in the country.""

A youth in Aseomuku identified as Endurance Ossai was killed when soldiers used their speedboat to intentionally ram into the boat in which him and his colleagues were travelling. The youths were taking photographs of oil spillage in their community when the incident happened.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram ambushed a group of soldiers along the Ajiri-Dikwa road in Borno State. The ensuing clash left 30 Boko Haram and seven soldiers dead.
The Maritime Workers Union of Nigeria protest over government interference with port management.

Six members of Uwheru and Ohoro were by killed by marauding Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herders have been maiming, kidnapping and killing members of the community. Two policemen were also killed in the attack.

Six members of Uwheru and Ohoro were by killed by marauding Fulani herdsmen. It was reported that the herders have been maiming, kidnapping and killing members of the community. Two policemen were also killed in the attack.

Some gunmen, in the early hours of 10/02, attacked a police station at Eika community in Okehi Local Government Area of Kogi State, killing two policemen and a detainee. The gunmen also attacked the residence of the chairman of the community, Mallam Sadiq Obomi and shot him dead.

Some gunmen, in the early hours of 10/02, attacked a police station at Eika community in Okehi Local Government Area of Kogi State, killing two policemen and a detainee. The gunmen also attacked the residence of the chairman of the community, Mallam Sadiq Obomi and shot him dead.
A suspected armed robber was set ablaze along the South core road within the premises of the Federal University of Agriculture (FUAM), Makurdi in Benue State.

Members of civil society groups and celebrities protested in Lagos and Abuja over the ""current economic hardship in the country."" The police became involved in Lagos when they blocked the entrance to the airport to prevent entry from the demonstrators.
Militias from Oku Iboku and Ikot Offiong clash over two days over suspected boundary issues. Twenty dead.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Motorcycle operators protest alleged extortion at the hands of NURTW 'at the weekend,' sparking a clash. Three reported deaths and other injuries.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacked Mussa village, destroying houses. Causalities not known.

A soldier is shot and killed at a funeral. It was reported that the soldier was killed when he fired at a man who tried to pay some respect to the dead during a funeral through gunshots. The man retaliated the gunshot by the soldier, killing the later.
Labour unions protest at the office of the governor for unknown reason. Police blocked the entrance of the office to bar the demonstrators from entering.
Militias from Oku Iboku and Ikot Offiong clash over two days over suspected boundary issues. Twenty dead.

Five members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were shot dead by soldiers. It was reported that the soldiers invaded the venue of the meeting of their members. About 20 persons were injured in the invasion.
A man was killed by unidentified gunmen. The victim was hacked to death with a machete by 2 young boys after he was stopped while riding on a motorcycle. The reasons for the attack are not known.

A Monarch (Chief EWmmanuel Umahaeyo) and a youth leader (Comrade Esit-Ime Emmanson) were assassinated by gunmen for challenging a youth faction that hijacked the management and control of the community revenue from an oil palm plantation. The date of the incident was not given.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack Mifa, Chibok LGA killing an Islamic scholar and breaking the hands of an unnamed boy. Soldiers stationed in Chibok were quickly drafted and we're able to repel the attack killing one of the attackers.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack Mifa, Chibok LGA killing an Islamic scholar and breaking the hands of an unnamed boy. Soldiers stationed in Chibok were quickly drafted and we're able to repel the attack killing one of the attackers.

A group of women called ""Nigeria Women"", on 13/02 protested at the premises of the Lagos Division of the Federal High Court to protest former First Lady, Patience Jonathan's ""harassed and maltreatment.""
A solider is killed at Oweto, Agatu LGA by ""a gang of militant Agatu youths.""
Students of the Federal Polytechnic, Auchi in Edo State, have trooped to the streets protesting against the management of the institution. It was reported the students blocked roads.

The premises of Osun State High Court, Ilesa was in the early hours of 13/01 set ablaze by yet to be identified persons. According to sources, the perpetrators attacked the security man attached to the court premises and inflicted machete cuts on him before spraying the court premises with petrol and set it ablaze.

Unidentified gunmen clad in military camouflage struck at a farm at Igbodu area of Epe, Lagos State, abducting seven persons. The victims are two private guards, said to be members of the Oodua People's Congress, OPC, and five farm workers at Eliasa Farm.
Plain cloths militiamen suspected to backed by the government, attacked a group protesting against the ceding of land to Fulani herdsmen for cattle grazing. Extent of injuries not known.

Two people died in a communal clash between 2 neighbouring communities of Mbaduku in Vandeikya Council and Obudu Local Government in Cross River State. Youths from Obodu destroyed a cassava farm and that led to the fight that claimed the 2 lives.

Extra Judicial Killing: 6 persons, including a pregnant woman, were killed by rampaging soldiers. It was reported that the killing was in retaliation for the killing of a soldier by a member of the community the previous day.

Four armed robbers were set ablaze by vigilante mob at different locations - White House Street and Abua by Ephraim Street. The victims were among about 30 robbers who had harassed and robbed residents.

column7: TJMN: Truth and Justice Movement of Nigeria
column17: Following anti-government protests in major cities across Nigeria the previous week, a coalition of Buhari Support Groups known as TJMN hold a counter protest.
Pensioners protest non-payment of gratuity in Calabar.
Police make arrests in Minna as students violently protest the death of a footballer on the field.
Armed students attack their teachers with blunt weapons and cause damage to their on 16/02. The reasons for the violence is not known. Injuries, causalities not known.
Two unidentified armed robbers were burnt to death by residents of Nyong Edem Street off White House, Calabar.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: ""Dozens"" of Boko Haram members including civilians were feared dead in a crossfire that ensued between military troops/Civilian JTF and the group, most of whom were suicide bombers who attempted to infiltrate Maiduguri. The attack occurred in two stages. First, suicide bombers attempted to attack a military escort to Gamboru Ngala, then an exchange of gunfire around Muna Garrage general area. Unconfirmed report also has it that six members of civilian JTF sustained critical injuries while attempting to repel the attacks. Premium Times claims 11 dead.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated a pack in the midst of 13 trucks along Maiduguri/ Mafa road during the late hours of the day. The bomber was reported dead, along with destruction of the trucks. The attack was likely in coordination with the attack on Maiduguri.
Three elders were stoned to death by youths, who protested the death of boat mishap victims. It was reported that the youths accused the elders of being behind the death of the 8 victims.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram fired repeatedly at a Mi-17 military helicopter on a humanitarian mission between Maiduguri and Gwoza, injuring one airman. A fighter jet and helicopter gunship were immediately scrambled and retaliated, killing two scores of the insurgents at the located threat.
Residents of Jos stormed the Jos Electricity Distribution Company, JEDC, over high electricity tariff, fake metres and other perceived 'gross injustices' meted on consumers in the state.
A women's group protest at the government house in Kano over a spate of abductions of teenagers in the State.

column7: NUAHP: Nigerian Union of Allied Health Professionals; Health Workers (Nigeria)
column17: Health workers under the aegis of the Nigerian Union of Allied Health Professionals, NUAHP staged a rally in Lagos to protest what they described as 'endemic corruption' in the health sector.

column7: AWAM: Association of Waste Managers of Nigeria
column17: The Association of Waste Managers of Nigeria, (AWAM) protest at the Lagos House Assembly over a bill that would ""jeopardise their business.""
A group, ""Ekpoma Concerned Stakeholders Forum"", staged a peaceful protest calling on the federal government to repair the Expoma axis of the Benin-Auchi -Okene highway.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 17 February 2017, scores of Boko Haram (ISWAP) and locals lost their lives in an attack by heavily armed fighters as they attempted to storm Maiduguri through its border with Mafa. It is not clear if military forces were involved.
Residents of Umuode community, Osisoma Ngwa council area, Abia State protest the poor electricity supply and high bills being issued to them by the Enugu Electricity Distribution Company.
Students of the Federal University of Technology, Owerri violently protest student fees. Fifteen arrests reported.
Gowon Estate residents disrupted the operations at the Ikeja Electric Plc, Akowonjo Business Unit (Lagos) over a three week electrical blackout. The protesters blocked the entrance to the premises.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three female Boko Haram suicide bombers stormed a motor park in the state capital, blew themselves and 2 others up. The 2 civilian victims were among the Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) waiting to return to their homes. Another conflicting source reported 'scores' died in the attack.

Fulanis attack several villages in Kaura and Bakin Kogi over two days (as well as Ashim, Nissi and Zilan in Ataka District), destroying homes and killing 22 people. Reports vary - Nigeria watch indicates 17 are dead in Kaura, and five in Bakin Kogi. The first attack occurred in Kaura LGA during the mid-evening and the second in Bakin Kogi the following morning. Nigeria Watch reports the attack occurred over three days.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacked Yaza-Kumaza village at about 4 p.m. on 19/02, killing three.
Students of Ambrose Alli University, Ekpoma protest a departmental levy. The protest was quickly ended by the group's internal conflict.
Ten members of the APC are injured when they were attacked by ""thugs"" during a party meeting.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram insurgents attacked Yaza-Kumaza village and killed no fewer than 4 persons.
Students of the University of Abuja on 20/02 blocked the Airport road in protest of a colleague who was knocked down and killed by area robbers.

Fulanis attack several villages in Kaura and Bakin Kogi over two days (as well as Ashim, Nissi and Zilan in Ataka District), destroying homes and killing 22 people. The first attack occurred in Kaura LGA during the mid-evening and the second in Bakin Kogi the following morning. Nigeria Watch reports the attack occurred over three days.

Unidentified gunmen abduct two German archaeologists and kill two hunters in Janjela village, reasons not known. Source published on 22/02, exact date of attack not known. The Germans were later freed.
A lecturer with College of Education, Katsina Ala and a All Progressive Congress (APC) ward chairman were killed by unknown assailants. The ward chairman was linked to a kidnap gang.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least seven soldiers were killed in a Boko Haram attack on military positions in Gajiram on 22/02.

On 23 February 2017, senior military officers tortured and killed another officer near the Ihejirika Military Quarters along the Abuja-Nyanya Expressway (Abuja Municipal LGA, FCT) for travelling to Lagos to see his sick aunt without official permission.

Youths gather near South African firms in Abuja to protest a series of recent attacks against Nigerians in South Africa. The protesters caused property damage. The group was dispersed by security forces.
NUJ workers of Bayelsa State Broadcasting Corporation (Glory FM) have downed tools and shut down the station over an industrial dispute with its management.
Kwara students protest unpaid bursary allowance in Ilorin on 23/02.
Eight are dead in Mbahimin community, Benue State, following a attack on farmers by Funalis.
APC and AD supporters clash in Ondo during an event for the former. Four reported dead.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) has struck a Boko Haram base at Tagoshe/Mandara Mountain general area about 10km Southwest of Gwoza in Northern Borno. 24 Boko Haram fatalities reported.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military air forces destroy a Boko Haram anti-aircraft gun, as well as several vehicle travelling in a convoy at Talala, northern Borno. Causalities not known.
A handheld grenade exploded on 25/02 at Bari village, Niger State killing four. The explosion was believed to have been caused by the mishandling of a grenade.
Electricity customers block a highway in Sapele over poor service. The protest occurred ""at the weekend.""
A group of 50, identified only as ""political thugs"" attack and kidnapped an election worker in suburban Owerri, at Ulakwo. Many of the group was later arrested. The victims sustained injuries.
Security forces arrest three Chadian Boko Haram members in (Barnawi faction - coded as ISWAP) in Gombe after shooting one in the leg.
Protesters gather at a PDP headquarters in Abuja over a conflict of party leadership. It is not known if the protesters were members of the PDP themselves.
A suspected thief is mobbed to death along Yellow Duke Street, Calabar.
One person died in a clash involving indigenes and suspected herdsmen when herdsmen wreaked havoc on the indigenes farmlands. This incident is linked to an event in Delta State
20-year-old gospel musician Ifedolapo Atansuyi was tortured to death in police custody. The victim was arrested for selling an iPhone worth about N200, 000 under his care.

column6: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A male suicide bomber who disguised as a woman was killed in Borno on 27/02 by members of the state Civilian-Joint Task Force (CJTF). Exact location within the state not known.

Two people were killed in a clash involving indigenes and suspected herdsmen when herdsmen wreaked havoc on the indigenes farmlands in Omumu community. The event is linked to a clash in Rivers State on the same day.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: From 27/02 to 07/03 Cameroonian forces of the Multinational Joint Task Force claims to have killed 60 Boko Haram and liberated 5,000 civilians in an cross border operation in Bama and Gwoza LGAs. Dates and locations of specific causalities not known.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: From 27/02 to 07/03 Cameroonian forces of the Multinational Joint Task Force claims to have killed 60 Boko Haram and liberated 5,000 civilians in an cross border operation in Bama and Gwoza LGAs. Dates and locations of specific causalities not known.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 18 Boko Haram militants were killed by the troops when the insurgents invaded Kumuya in Gujba LGA. It was reported that the perpetrators attacked the village to cart away food but were overpowered.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: From 27/02 to 07/03 Cameroonian forces of the Multinational Joint Task Force claims to have killed 60 Boko Haram and liberated 5,000 civilians in an cross border operation in Bama and Gwoza LGAs. Dates and locations of specific causalities not known.
