column17: MASSOB protested in Onitsha to mark the 17th anniversary of the call for the Republic of Biafra.
Unidentified gunmen attack and kill three members of a local militia in Ofu LGA. The attackers may be the same gunmen who attacked a nearby masquerade party the following day.

column7: NUATE: National Union of Air Transport Employees
column17: NUATE protests poor welfare.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Supporters of seven persons accused of complicity in the murder of former Ekiti State National Union of Road Transport Workers' (NURTW's) Chairman Omolafe Aderiye protested in Ado-Ekiti what they called 'prolonged trial and incarceration.'

A verbal argument led to a general clash between Tiv and Jukun groups. Following the initial argument on the evening of 22/05, Jukun groups attacked Tiv locations, shooting sporadically. The attack led to a mobilization of the Tiv and counter attack. The subsequent clash lasted two days. One death reported the first day, two the second.
Police disperse El-Zakzaky IM protesters with tear gas and water cannons in Abuja. No reported violence from the protesters.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Police dispersed a precession by Movement for the Actualisation of the Sovereign State of Biafra (MASSOB) at Government Craft Centre bus stop on Aba road in Port Harcourt. No reported violence from the demonstrators.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: The Nigeria Union of Local Government Employees (NULGE) Delta State chapter commenced a mass rally at Effurum, Warri to protest against non-payment of salaries to local govt staff in the state.
Unidentified gunmen open fire on a masquerade party in Okere, killing seven.

A verbal argument led to a general clash between Tiv and Jukun groups. Following the initial argument on the evening of 22/05, Jukun groups attacked Tiv locations, shooting sporadically. The attack led to a mobilization of the Tiv and counter attack. The subsequent clash lasted two days. One death reported the first day, two the second.
Youth leaders in Odukpani protest for the release of 17 colleagues who had been arrested for weapons possession.
Over 2000 Local Government pensioners slept at the gate of the Benue State Government House, in Makurdi, to protest non-payment of their pension.

column7: IPMAN: Independent Petroleum Marketers Association of Nigeria
column17: The industrial action embarked upon by members of the Independent Petroleum Marketers Association of Nigeria (IPMAN) stopped economic and business activities in Calabar. This is coming as tanker drivers' staged a protest over N12, 800 road maintenance levy imposed on them by the state government.
Eight are injured and 32 arrested after a student election becomes violent following a voting delay.

Students of the Ladoke Akintola University of Texhnology, LAUTECH, gathered in Osogbo protest the continued closure of the school and demand for the payment of about nine months salaries owed their lecturers.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 24 May 2017, three suicide bombers detonate their packs in Dolori area (Maiduguri, Borno), killing only themselves. Security operatives encountered the bombers shortly before the blast.
A group organized as EYAC protest petroleum marketers in the state for cutting off the fuel supply to residents. Protesters also demonstrated at in Dalimore and Adebayo areas of the State.

column7: SSANU: Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities
column17: SSANU and residents of Otuaka protest alleged marginalization over government employment. The protesters blocked roads.

column7: ARD: Association of Resident Doctors; Health Workers (Nigeria)
column17: The gates of the Lagos University Teaching Hospital was shut for at least one hour following a peaceful protest by the health workers under the auspices of Joint House unions and the Association of Resident Doctors (ARD) branch.
The Nigerian Army has commissioned a Forward Operation Base (FOB) in Kafanchan.
A mob attacks and kills a man they suspect of murder.
Youths of Nnewi community, organized as the NYF, protest the continued incarceration of an individual who had not been given a trial.

Some gunmen, suspected to be ""militants"", have reportedly launched an attack on Igbo-Nla Model College, Epe, in Lagos State. Six pupils of the school were allegedly kidnapped in the process. Other injuries not known.
Arrests: Military forces raid a Boko Haram (actor not confirmed) hideout in Gidan Mai, Mokwa LGA, and arrest three 'kingpins' - Mustapha Muhammed (Adam Bitri), Ali Saleh and Uba Mohammed.
Workers at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs staged a protest to demand for diplomatic passports, clothing allowance, training of officers among others.
A day following the kidnap of six students in Epe, parents protest insecurity at the school.
Some indigenes of Ile Ife in Osun have staged a protest over what they called forceful takeover of their farmland by ""encroachers from neighbouring villages.""
A gateman attached to a politician (party affiliation not known) in Sime and his kin were killed by unknown gunmen.

column7: APGA: All Progressives Grand Alliance Party
column17: Youths of the All Progressives Grand Alliance (APGA) in Anambra State protest a court judgement against their party.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram captures and beheads five IDPs at Nguro in Konduga local government area.
University of Ibadan students protest, alleging insensitivity on the part of the university management.
At least two are dead during clash among APC members during violent party primaries in Oshodi. Among the dead included a NURTW leader and APC member.

column7: CCBS: Concerned Citizens of Bayelsa State
column17: Under the aegis of Concerned Citizens of Bayelsa State, a group protests the arrest and detention of Special Adviser to the Managing Director of Niger Delta Development Commission, NDDC on charges of fraud. The protesters saw the arrest as political.
Police officers and naval personnel clash in Calabar following a traffic incident. Ten deaths reported.
A notable local performer protests area crime in the Ada-George area of the Garden City, Obio/Akpor Local Government Area.
Pensioners in Kwara State have protested in Ilorin over a Supreme Court decision that effects their payments.

column17: A lone suicide bomber was on Tuesday afternoon shot dead by Civilian JTF as he was making attempts to enter a military barracks in Maiduguri.

Staff of Revenue consultants attached to Benue State Internal Revenue Board protested at the government house in Maurdi over ""incessant harassment and intimidation by police monitoring unit of Inspector General of Police.""

column17: Unidentified gunmen kidnap a PDP lawmaker around Abuja-Jere axis of the Abuja-Kaduna highway.
Members of the Nigeria Medical Association, NMA, Osun State Chapter, marched on the streets of Osogbo to protest the state government's payment of half salaries.

No fewer than four were killed following a deadly clash between Ofunakpa Inyimagu community in Ikwo Local Government Area of Ebonyi State and its counterpart in Nsobo community in Obubra council area of Cross River State. The clash also led to the destruction of 50 houses and displacement of Ofunakpa Inyimagu community members. The clash began following am attack by Nsobo militia.
No fewer than 14 persons are killed and six kidnapped in Sime community in Tai Local Government Area of Rivers State, when gunmen invaded the area on the night of 01/06.
Following a murder, a vigilante mob attacks and kills a suspect in Ogboko, Ideato South LGA.
Drivers block a highway in protest of area crime.

There was a protest on 01/06 at the office of the Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board (JAMB) in Lagos as thousands of UTME candidate accused the tertiary admission examination body of collection money without services rendered.

A police sergeant is killed during a successful attempt to thwart kidnappers from attacking a PDP official in Akenfia community in Yenagoa Local Government Area. The attack occurred ""at the weekend.""
Students protest alleged government corruption, particularly that of the governor.
Residents protest the planned removal of a tree considered sacred. On the same day, Students protest alleged government corruption for the second time in three days.

Two are dead in violence related to a land dispute between Amai and Umuebu communities in Ukwuani Local Government Area. Though it is known that the Amai and Umuebu communities were involved, it is not clear who were aggressor and who were the victims.
A suspected member of a street gang is lynched by vigilantes.
Unidentified gunmen on motorcycles shot and killed two police officers in Onitsha, reasons not known.
Supporters of a person convicted of being an accessory to a bombing protest in Yenagoa for release.

Over 50 pregnant women receiving prenatal and antenatal medical attention at the Amaku General Hospital Awka, Anambra State protested against increase in the cost of services at the state government-owned hospital.
Members of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Kaduna State protested at the State House of Assembly against the party's failure to deliver on a political promise.
Communities in Osun State protested at the premises of the state High Court in Ilesa against what they called illegal acquisition of their land by the state governor.
Traders protest against a Ijaw-imposed lockout from markets.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Thirteen civilians (raised to 17 later in the week upon police conformation - Sahara Reporters) are killed in a combined gunman/suicide bomber attack by Boko Haram on Maiduguri. The attacks occurred ay four locations throughout the city. In response, military forces pushed back the attackers, ""neutralizing"" them - numbers not known.
A coalition of civil society groups on 07/06 staged a protest in Abuja demanding an end to the planned introduction of Genetically Modified Organisms, GMOs, into Nigeria's foods and farming scheme.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks civilians in Hambagda, abducting six and killing four others. The attacks were an apparent revenge following the arrest of Boko Haram commander Adamu Rugurugu in the village the previous day.

Students of Ladoke Akintola University of Technology (LAUTECH), Ogbomosho protested at the National Assembly over the closure of their institution for over nine months following an industrial dispute between staff of the institution and local governments.
Unidentified gunmen killed a Fulani civilian and abducted a second at Gulida village in Abaji Area Council during the overnight hours.
Two children are killed and three others injured after a unidentified ""vigilante"" gave the youth a polythene bag carrying an explosive.

Staff of Lagos State Polytechnic (LASPOTECH), Ikorodu, demonstrated at the Lagos State House of Assembly to protest non-payment of outstanding arrears.
A soldier shot and killed a civilian over a ""minor dispute"" in Kaduna. The shooting led to a protest.
After a security officer shot and killed a civilian over a ""minor dispute,"" area residents protest the action.

Hundreds in Elele-Uzairue, Etsako West Local Government Area, staged a protest on Auchi-Okene-Highway, following the killing of a middle-aged woman by suspected Fulani herdsmen. It is not clear if the protesters blocked the road. The attack took place in Uluoke, near Auchi in Etsako West, date not known.
Suspected [Fulani] herdsmen attack and killed a local resident in Uluoke, near Auchi. Date of the attack not known. A demonstration against the act took place on 10/06.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Soldiers and unnamed local militia fend off a Boko Haram attack on 10/06. Causalities not known.

On 11 June 2017, electricity customers protest a power cut to their area in Lagos.
On 11 June 2017, a ""Our Mumu Don Do"" protest was held in commemoration of June 12 (1993) Struggle. [size=no report].

At least 3 killed and five injured when unknown gunmen attacked people at the Kogi State polytechnic gate, Lokoja where senator Dino Melaye (APC) was holding a protest against the state government. One of the attackers targeted the Senator, but failed. Later, the Senator blamed the State governor of being behind the attack, though those claims were not independently substantiated.
Cattle breeders protest a state open grazing prohibition in Jalingo.
Federal legislative aids protested the death of a colleague who was unable to pay a hospital bill.

Two separate and simultaneous protests in Minna. The first, pensioners blockade several entry points of the city over payments. The were dispersed by police after several hours. The second, artisans protest tax rates.

Two separate and simultaneous protests in Minna. The first, pensioners blockade several entry points of the city over payments. The were dispersed by police after several hours. The second, artisans protest tax rates.

Employees of a paint company protest ""unwholesome treatment"" by management.

Three persons were killed and five injured when unknown gunmen attacked six communities (Bambami, Tsanni, Dabai Bayawa, Makatanawa, Dan Iya and Alale) in Batagarawa LGA in Katsina State.
Students of the Adeyemi College of Education (ACE) Ondo in Ondo State on 15/06, protested over a traffic accident involving three students of the institution on 11/06.
Truckers violently protest alleged extortion by police, police fire into the air to disperse the group. One injury reported.
Pensioners held a demonstration in Bauchi to oppose the planned recall of the Bauchi State secretary of the Nigeria Union of Pensioners (NUP).

Two local ""vigilante"" groups clash in Kuje on the evening of 17/06, after one of the factions attempted to arrest someone in the area. One death reported.

column17: Boko Haram attack military forces along Damboa-Biu road on 17/06, killing two.

column17: Boko Haram suicide bomber killed 17 in a displaced persons camp of Dolori in Kofa.

Three are set ablaze in mob action for allegedly stealing mobile phones.

Mambilla militia attacks Fulani communities in Sardauna LGA over four days (believed to be between 18-22/06) after they allege a leader was arrested by Fulani members. At least 18 dead, 130 missing and thousands of cattle either slaughtered or stolen.

One person died on 19/06 while four others sustained injuries during a violent clash between Hausa and Igbo traders at Kuje.

The attackers opened fire on a group of 15 police officers, all of whom survived. A civilian farmer was killed. Fulanis attacked the farm the previous weekend as well.

column17: Three civilian loggers are killed by a Boko Haram landmine in Abbari village, Konduga LGA.

Youths and Hausa traders clash after a tax was demanded of them. It is not clear if the youths were representatives of the government. Two dead and a church was destroyed in the melee.

Mambilla militia attacks Fulani communities in Sardauna LGA over four days (believed to be between 18-22/06) after they allege a leader was arrested by Fulani members. At least 18 dead, 130 missing and thousands of cattle either slaughtered or stolen.

column17: NULGE members protest unpaid salaries.

column17: Market traders, calling themselves the ""Igbona Market Women Petty Traders Association"" protest a government mandate over the standardization over the use of measuring scales.

Teachers in Ebonyi State (exact location not reported) protested against an alleged plan by the Federal Government to hand over the payment of primary school teachers' salaries to local governments in Nigeria.
Community militias of Billiri and Shomgom LGAs clash on 23/06. Causalities not known. The clash led to the death of a police officer later in the week.
A group protest for an increase of police pay.

Four are dead in a ""illegal structure"" removal operation in a Suleja suburb. It was reported that many [residents] offered ""stiff resistance"" to the removal, as police fired bullets to push them away.

The Nigeria Union of Teachers (NUT) in Katsina State protest a plan that would give local LGAs control over education.
Residents of Igbatoro, Akure North LGA protest a Fulani attack which killed a farmer in the area in recent weeks.
A student is beheaded on Osogbo, reasons not known. Three suspects were later arrested.
Residents of Effurun protest a prolonged power outage, preventing access on a major road.
Residents of Ibeju Lekki area of Lagos State staged a protest at the State House of Assembly alleging forceful takeover of their land by land grabbers.

Amuwo-Odofin chairmanship aspirants of the APC (and their supporters) protest across the LGA over what they called 'unacceptable imposition' of consensus chairmanship candidate on residents of the council for the poll. The group protested the following day at the State Secretariat, Ikeja.
Teachers under the aegis of Nigerian Union of Teachers (NUT), Oyo State Wing gathered in the streets of Ibadan, the Oyo state capital to protest the proposed local government autonomy.
Residents of Alegbor Community in Uvwie Local Government Area of Delta State protest a prolonged power outage. A similar protest took place in the area the previous day.
Islamic State reported to have attacked Kano city, northern Nigeria, saying they killed four and injured two Nigerian policemen, seizing weapons and ammunition in the course of the assault.
Militias from Wanikade town and their Wanhihem neighbours clash over the use of farmland between 28/06 and 06/07. 100+ believed dead, property destroyed and 14,000 displaced.
A suspected street gang member is attacked and killed by a group of vigilantes ""earlier this week,"" source dated 01/07.

A police officer is shot and killed in Gombe while on deployment to bring peace to a communal clash between communities of Shongom and Billiri Local Government Areas of the state, who had clashed the previous Friday (23/06). The perpetrator's identity is not known.

Aggrieved members of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Amuwo Odofin Local Government Area protested at the State Secretariat over the imposition of candidates. The protesters later went to a leader's office in Ikoyi and the state party secretariat to register similar complaints.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: An officer and three soldiers are dead following a Boko Haram IED blast on a road between Kangarwa and Alagarno villages. Several other soldiers were injured.

column7: FRPSO: Forum of 2011/12 Retired Public Servants of Osun
column17: Under the aegis of 'Forum of 2011/12 Retired Public Servants of Osun' demonstrators block Olaiya Junction in protest of the non-payment of pensions.

Aggrieved members of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Amuwo Odofin Local Government Area protested at the State Secretariat over the imposition of candidates. The protesters later went to a leader's office in Ikoyi and the state party secretariat to register similar complaints.
NUT teachers in Illorin protest against funding and management of primary school education by the local government councils in the state.
NUT teachers protest a plan by State Government to return the management of primary schools to the local government authorities. The protest took place at the State Assembly complex.
Militias of Odo-Owa and Ilofa communities clash in Oke-Ero LGA. The result of the clash is not known. One reported arrest.
Militias from Wanikade town and their Wanhihem neighbours clash over the use of farmland between 28/06 and 06/07. 100+ believed dead, property destroyed and 14,000 displaced.
Vigilantes kill a man they suspect of being involved in gang activity.
Militias from Wanikade town and their Wanhihem neighbours clash over the use of farmland between 28/06 and 06/07. 100+ believed dead, property destroyed and 14,000 displaced.

column7: FRPSO: Forum of 2011/12 Retired Public Servants of Osun
column17: Pensioners under the aegis of 'Forum of 2011/12 Retired Public Servants of Osun' on 30/06 barricaded the entrance to the Government Secretariat, preventing workers from entering their offices. The protest was over the non-payment of stipends. The protest began the previous day, with protesters blocking Olaiya Junction.
Militias from Wanikade town and their Wanhihem neighbours clash over the use of farmland between 28/06 and 06/07. 100+ believed dead, property destroyed and 14,000 displaced.
Militias from Wanikade town and their Wanhihem neighbours clash over the use of farmland between 28/06 and 06/07. 100 + believed dead, property destroyed and 14,000 displaced.
Two are killed by unidentified gunmen in Ukanafun LGA on 02/07.
Non-violent activity: gunmen raid the house of APC notable Dikvie Ikiogha and disarm the policeman guarding him. The politician was away and his family were interrogated but were not hurt.
Militias from Wanikade town and their Wanhihem neighbours clash over the use of farmland between 28/06 and 06/07. 100+ believed dead, property destroyed and 14,000 displaced.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Agreement: 700 Boko Haram insurgents around the fringes of Sambisa Forest in Borno surrendered to military forces. Military forces announced the development on 03/07, though the date(s) of the arrest are not known.
NUT teachers hold a school funding protest in Ado-Ekiti.
Militias from Wanikade town and their Wanhihem neighbours clash over the use of farmland between 28/06 and 06/07. 100+ believed dead, property destroyed and 14,000 displaced.

On 04 July 2017, hundreds of Gbagyi people - indigenes of the Federal Capital Territory, Abuja gathered the streets of the capital city to protest alleged marginalisation and deprivation by the Federal Government. [size=100].
On 4 July 2017, Boko Haram forces loyal to Abu Mus'ab Al-Barnawi (coded as ISWAP) attack military forces at Kamuya [Kamzua] (Kwaya Kusar, Borno), killing one.
Several groups supportive of President Muhammadu Buhari and Governor Rochas Okorocha march through Owerri. The gathering was in reaction to a planned anti-government protest that never materialized.
NUT holds a school funding protest in Abuja.
Militias from Wanikade town and their Wanhihem neighbours clash over the use of farmland between 28/06 and 06/07. 100+ believed dead, property destroyed and 14,000 displaced.
A PDP member of the House of Representatives was attacked in Otta by ""gun bearing thugs."" The target of the attack survived, though a supporter was killed by stray gun fire.
Students of Osun State University (UNIOSUN) in Osogbo protested the killing of a fellow student by suspected ritualists.

Suspected ""militants"" attack soldiers on a military formation at Ogbogbagbene community, Burutu Local Government Area of Delta State. One soldier reported dead, ""scores"" injured. The attack took place at 0200hrs.
Militias from Wanikade town and their Wanhihem neighbours clash over the use of farmland between 28/06 and 06/07. 100+ believed dead, property destroyed and 14,000 displaced.

column7: NMA: Nigeria Medical Association; Health Workers (Nigeria)
column17: NMA medical doctors working with Osun Government staged protest over the non-payment of salary arrears and poor condition of hospitals.
Two soldiers dead and a civilian injured after ""suspected [Delta] militants"" attack in Sapele LGA.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three suicide bombers attack a male hostel at the university of Maiduguri. Two detonated their packs, while the third was shot and killed by security operatives.The only fatalities were of the bombers.
Unidentified gunmen assassinated a youth leader and an attorney in Ukanafun. The reason for the attack is not known.
On 8 July 2017, IS West Africa militants attacked Nigerian army soldiers in Kamia in Yobe, killing 12 soldiers and seizing weapons and ammunitions.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces clash with Boko Haram at Hambaga. Five Boko Haram reported dead.
Leprosy patients at the Eku Leprosy Settlement, Delta State have protest non-payment of their monthly stipend by the state government in Asaba.
Residents protest after a military cadet is murdered by suspected street gang members.

Two sons of a traditional ruler, Chief Oliver Wobo, are found beheaded on 11/07 after disappearing on 10/07. Perpetrators not known. The ruler had passed away at an earlier date; the political power of the sons was not described by the source.

Protest at the entrance of Imo State House against a plan by the state government to provide monetary resources to a traditional ruler in the state. The protesters blocked the entrance to the government house.

column7: ASUU: Academic Staff Union of Universities; Teachers (Nigeria)
column17: ASUU staff staged a protest to register their grievances over the detention of the former Acting Vice Chancellor of their university in the custody of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission on corruption charges.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces clear Gashigar, Asaga, Bukarti and other unnamed neighbouring villages of Boko Haram on 11/07. No reported violence.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces dislodge Boko Haram elements from Dawashi Gari village in an area bordering Lake Chad. Four dead.

column6: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four Boko Haram suicide bombers attack the Maiduguri area, including Doloi, Judumeri and Polo-Sabongari areas. 12 Civilian JTF members and seven civilians reported killed in the incidents. 21 injured.
Staff and students of Obafemi Awolowo University (OAU) Ile-Ife, staged violent protest at the premises of the State High Court, Ede after the former Acting Vice Chancellor was sentenced to prison.
Maritime workers protest a proposed bill that they believe would hurt their industry. Protests took place in Warri and Lagos. Several labour unions were involved.
Maritime workers protest a proposed bill that they believe would hurt their industry. Protests took place in Warri and Lagos. Several labour unions were involved.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces clear Gashigar, Asaga, Bukarti and other unnamed neighbouring villages of Boko Haram on 11/07. No reported violence.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces on patrol encounter Boko Haram elements at Kanama, neutralize two and recover weapons.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces clear Gashigar, Asaga, Bukarti and other unnamed neighbouring villages of Boko Haram on 11/07. No reported violence.

column6: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four Boko Haram suicide bombers attack the Maiduguri area, including Doloi, Judumeri and Polo-Sabongari areas. 12 Civilian JTF members and seven civilians reported killed in the incidents. 21 injured.
Nigeria Union of Teachers (NUT) of the Gombe state branch staged a protest to the office of the Head of Service over the ""handling of their welfare by the local government authorities.""

""Some days ago [from 16/07],"" a vigilante mob of Kadara youths attacked and killed a suspected criminal at Banono. The victim was Fulani, and the attack launched a larger communal conflict in the following week.
Lecturers at Moshood Abiola Polytechnic, (MAPOLY) Abeokuta, shut the entrance gate of the institution to protest a staffing issue.
Pensioners who retired from the service of the Edo State Government and Local Government Councils protested the alleged non-payment of their pension and gratuity arrears on 12/07.
Elders of Oghede community in Ovia North-East Local Government Area of Edo State protested alleged encroachment of their land by the Nigerian Army. The protest took place in Benin City.
Protests reported after a judge dismisses the case of two Britons who allegedly defrauded an area company.
Militia from neighbouring Ijutun-Idoru attack Ofioji in Izzi LGA, killing nine and destroying several homes. The violence is related to land usage.
On 14 October 2017, 36 civilians were killed and 19 wounded in a military bombing of the village of Jimina near Lake Chad.
Property destruction: Gunmen attacked a community in Chikun area of the state where they destroyed houses. No human causality reported.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A 12 year-old Fulani cattle breeder was killed in a bomb blast at Muna Delti area of Jere Local Government Council after members of Boko Haram strapped him with an IED. The bomb detonated near the boy's residence. One other injury reported.
At least four Fulani herdsmen were killed by unknown gunmen in northern Kaduna State at Kajuru. The gunmen attacked another community in Chikun area of the state where they destroyed houses.

A Fulani group attacks a Kadara village of Ungwan Uka in retaliation for the vigilante killing of a suspected Fulani criminal in Banono last week. Five deaths reported. In turn, Kadara youths mobilized the following day and attacked a Fulani settlement twice, killing 22. Vanguard claims 37 dead total over the multi-day affair.
Pensioners barricaded popular Oba Ovonramwen Square in Benin for several hours over non-payment of gratuities and pension arrears. There were two protests, one on 17/07 and a second on 18/07.

A Fulani group attacks a Kadara village of Ungwan Uka in retaliation for the vigilante killing of a suspected Fulani criminal in Banono last week. Five deaths reported. In turn, Kadara youths mobilized the following day and attacked a Fulani settlement twice, killing 22.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Eight are dead following a Boko Haram suicide attack against a Maiduguri mosque. 13 others injured. Two other suicide bombers were shot and killed by security forces around the same time the mosque was attacked.

Following a suicide blast against a Maiduguri mosque, youths in the area, angered by recent bombings protest, attacked officials of the Borno State Emergency Management Agency (SEMA), who were on rescue mission at the scene of a suicide bomb attack in Maiduguri. The youths believed the group had not done enough to provide adequate security to the area. No injuries reported

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two are dead following an attempted suicide attack in Dolori. The bombers attempted to enter the area they were shot by security personnel. The attack was likely in coordination with a larger attack in nearby Maiduguri.

APC members protest in Mushin Local Government and Odi Olowo Local Council Development Area (LCDA) demanding the expulsion of their party's National Legal Adviser over allegations of embezzlement of campaign funds. The protest took place in Alausa.
Pensioners protest for a second day. No reported violence.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Six large explosions reported in Maiduguri on the night of 18/07. It is believed that military personnel fired artillery on a Boko Haram position near the city, killing 12.
Workers of the Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC) protest for three consecutive days over a salary issue. The workers blocked the entrance of the building.

column6: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column8: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Leadership tussle between factions of the Ondo State chapter of National Union of Road Transport Workers, NURTW, in Akure, the state capital, turned bloody as no fewer than 15 persons sustained machete injuries.

At least four ""Niger Delta militants"" were killed in the early hours while several others who were wounded escaped into the creeks following an attack on a military House Boat in Rivers State. The location was identified as ""Tuma House Boat"", which is near Abonnema.
Identified only as ""herdsmen,"" an armed group attacks Okueke, a farm settlement in Amoji community, Ndokwa West Local Government Area, Delta State, killing one and injuring another.
Youths blocked the Qua Iboe Terminal (QIT) facility of ExxonMobil at Mkpanak for three consecutive days in protest of an oil spill.

After a police officer's lethal shot against a tanker driver after refusing to pay a bribe, area residents protest, blocking roads and lighting fires. The protesters chased the suspected police officer, demanding justice.
Workers of the Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC) protest for three consecutive days over a salary issue. The workers blocked the entrance of the building.

A 20-year-old man in Ondewari Community in Bayelsa has died following a riotous clash between soldiers and youths suspected to be pipeline vandals. The clash was caused by protest by some youths in the community, who are aggrieved over their exclusion in the petroleum task force committee set up by the local government council. The exact date of the clash is a matter of dispute; it occurred sometime between the dates of 19/07 and 21/07.
Youths blocked the Qua Iboe Terminal (QIT) facility of ExxonMobil at Mkpanak for three consecutive days in protest of an oil spill.
Workers of the Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC) protest for three consecutive days over a salary issue. The workers blocked the entrance of the building.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces wound and capture one and kill eight during a bombardment of Boko Haram positions in Ngala.
Youths blocked the Qua Iboe Terminal (QIT) facility of ExxonMobil at Mkpanak for three consecutive days in protest of an oil spill.

Following the murder of a member of Uwheru town, local militia, assuming the perpetrators were from Unenurhe (this fact is not known), attacked the community, sparking a clash. At least one dead from the clash. Further, militia of Uwheru town held fifteen Unenurhe traders hostage. These events occurred ""at the weekend,"" source dated 24/07.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces foil a potential suicide bomb attack, kill three bombers.

On 27 July 2017, following the murder of a member of Uwheru town, local militia, assuming the perpetrators were from Unenurhe (this fact is not known), attacked the community, sparking a clash. At least one dead from the clash. Further, militia of Uwheru town held fifteen Unenurhe traders hostage. These events occurred ""at the weekend,"".
Members of IPOB protest at a Rivers State police station for the release of one of their members. The location was not named by the source. The release was granted.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram insurgents on 22/07 killed a leader of hunters and three of his men. The hunters were armed and attempted to defend their village, eventually repelling the attackers.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: One police officer is dead and two injured following a gun duel with Boko Haram in Kano. Following the incident, the police made five arrests. The perpetrators were believed to have fled Sambisa Forest in Borno when they were spotted.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Security forces spot a female suicide bomber attempting to gain access to displaced person's camp in Dalori. The perpetrator was chased before the IED exploded, killing only the bomber. In a separate incident the same night a male suicide bomber infiltrated the camp, killing three (plus himself) and injuring seventeen. A second attempt was tried the following morning.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Security forces spot a female suicide bomber attempting to gain access to displaced person's camp in Dalori. The perpetrator was chased before the IED exploded, killing only the bomber. In a separate incident the same night a male suicide bomber infiltrated the camp, killing three (plus himself) and injuring seventeen. A second attempt was tried the following morning.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Security forces spot a male suicide bomber attempting to gain access to a displaced person's camp during the early morning hours of 24/07. The perpetrator was chased before the IED exploded, killing only the bomber. A similar attempt was tried the night before in Dalori.
Students of Federal University, Oye-Ekiti, (FUOYE) barricaded the building's main gate in protest of alleged extortion by staff.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: NURTW commercial drivers protest over what they described as 'unhealthy' extortion and harassment of their members by men of Kaduna State Transport and Environmental Agency (KASTELEA).

Residents and traditional rulers of Ozalla community in Nkanu West Local Government Area of Enugu State gathered at Ozalla police station in protest, seeking security agents' protection of the community from alleged impending invasion of the community by herdsmen.
After the National Open University (NOUN) Asaba study centre refused to release student records, alumni protest.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Alau and Kaleri communities on the morning of 24/07. Twenty fatalities between the two towns.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Alau and Kaleri communities on the morning of 24/07. Twenty fatalities between the two towns.

Security personnel alleged to be operatives of the Joint Military Task Force, stormed Tuma community with heavy gunfire burning down 15 houses and leaving several people with bullet wounds. It is believed that attack was a retaliation following an attack on a military houseboat the previous week.

gunmen attacked homes of two stalwarts of APC, former acting Governor, Nestor Binabo in Azikoro near Yenagoa. The police engage the gunment who retreat. It is speculated that the raid was to kidnap the former governor.

Two students of the University of Benin (UNIBEN) were reportedly injured following a clash between post-graduate students and security operatives of the institution. The post-graduate students were reportedly protesting the introduction of what they termed 'payment of oral defence fees (External examiner fees) by the school management.
Hundreds of young Nigerians marched on the country's parliament on 25/07, calling for lawmakers to remove age barriers on political posts, including the presidency.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram kills 19 soldiers, 33 civilian militia, 17 civilians and kidnaps 10 oil researchers in Jibi, Magumeri LGA. The group included academic staff, drivers and other contractors. The group was being escorted by military forces. Later in the week Boko Haram released a video featuring several of the kidnap victims. Five of the kidnapped were feared to have been killed while 3 appeared in the video and 1 remained unaccounted for.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram kills 19 soldiers, 33 civilian militia, 17 civilians and kidnaps 10 oil researchers in Jibi, Magumeri LGA. The group included academic staff, drivers and other contractors. The group was being escorted by military forces. Later in the week Boko Haram released a video featuring several of the kidnap victims. Five of the kidnapped were feared to have been killed while 3 appeared in the video and 1 remained unaccounted for.
Hundreds of Echara community indigenes in Nsukka Local Government Area of Enugu State, protested at Enugu Government House a planned creation of a new autonomous community in the area.
A Kano women's group protests insecurity following a number of rape cases in the area.
Protest in Ogbunike over excess to public hygienic facilities.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military and Civilian JTF forces pursue a group of Boko Haram near Lake Chad who had recently kidnapped a group of oil researchers. The soldiers attacked the perpetrators, killing between 12-30 and rescuing several of the victims. Some reports indicate that military and civilians are among the dead.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four people have been killed in a suicide bomb attack at Mandirari Village in the Kondugu Local Government Area of Borno. The attack occurred during the morning hours.
The traditional ruler, Olowo of Owoland is assassinated in Yewa South Local Government area (formally Egbado South). Authorities made several arrests the following month.
Commercial sex workers in Port Harcourt protested plan by their manager to force them to attend a vigil.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Five are dead following a Boko Haram attack on Ajir. The assailants stormed the village early on 27/07, shooting and burning down houses, also taking food items and livestock in the community.

Eighteen are dead, several injured and houses destroyed in Aladja following a clash over land ownership. There are conflicting reasons why the clash started; each group blames the other for instigating the battle.

Hundreds of protesters and armed policemen clashed in Ibadan following the closure of the popular Temidire Sawmillers' Plank Market by the Ministry of Environment and Water Resources. One protester was struck by a bullet. The extent of the injury is not known.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Fourteen are dead and others injured following a Boko Haram suicide attack at Dikwa on 28/07.
Following a deadly car accident at a police checkpoint at a location between Owerri-Onitsha, a vigilante mob, blaming police insecurity for the crash, attacked and lynched two police officers.

Stakeholders from the host community to Eroton Exploration and Production Limited, in Bakana, Degema Local Government Area, Rivers State, barricaded the entrance to the oil firm in Port-Harcourt ""at the weekend"" following a disagreement on a compensation issue.
Two custom officers (police) are shot and killed in Shargalle by unidentified armed men.
Members of IPOB protest at a Ekwulobia church during a service while the Anambra governor was in attendance.

In Kaduna, ""armed thugs"" wounded two journalists and held the representatives of the central and northern senatorial districts of the state, Shehu Sani, Suleiman Hunkuyi (APC) and others hostage. The APC blamed ""disgruntled elements within the party"" for the violence, citing past instance in Yola (no date provided).
Iteskiri indigenes protest against conformation of a traditional leader ""recently.""

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Midlu on either 01/08 or 02/08, killing six civilians. Local area hunters pushed back the attackers, killing one.

Suspected ""hoodlums"" invaded the Kogi State House of Assembly, where the Speaker of the House and other politicians ""narrowly escaped death."" One person was beaten into a coma. The identity of the attackers is not known.

No fewer than 300 women drawn from various communities in Ibeshe, Ikorodu area of Lagos State embarked on a peaceful protest to the palace of two royal fathers the Onibeshe of Ibeshe land Oba Richard Ogunsanya and the Ayangburen of Ikorodu Oba Kabiru Shotobi over recent killings by the suspected street gang called Badoo.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Midlu on either 01/08 or 02/08, killing six civilians. Local area hunters pushed back the attackers, killing one.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks and kills three loggers in Aisa-Wulomari , 40km outside Maiduguri. Date of the attack not clear - local authorities made announcement of the attack on 02/08.
Fulanis killed a farmer who objected to their use of area farmland. The attack occurred ""last week."" Source dated 06/08. The attack led to a protest. Four suspects were later arrested.

Residents of Ijegun community in Lagos stage a protest against plans by the staff of Ikeja Distribution Company to distribute bills until they repair the broken down transformer which has thrown them to blackout.

500 students of the Anambra State Nwafor Orizu College of Education, Nsugbe took to the streets of Awka to protest alleged extortion by officials of the state government. The students sat on the road and refused to move for about an hour, preventing traffic on a major road.

Over 200 tricycle operators on 02/08 besieged the gate of state Government House Abakaliki in protest of what they described as excessive taxation by the state government. The protest blocked a nearby road and well as the gate of the building. Clashes with the police reported.
Protesters gather at the Lagos State governor's office, Alausa, Ikeja, demanding an end to sexual assault cases in the state and across the country.
A women's group protests a recent number of sexual assault cases in Gombe.
Pensioners protest over government funds at a state building in Abere.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two Boko Haram suicide bombers attempt to gain entry into a Maiduguri hospital before they and stopped by two barking dogs near the gate of the building. Only the bombers themselves reported dead from the blast.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three suicide bombers were killed by the military on 04/08 in the Simari area of Maiduguri. The group was attempting to enter town when they were encounter by military forces. The incident comes 16 hours following an attempted attack on a nearby hospital.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigerian security agencies on 04/08 foiled three suicide bombers who attempted to infiltrate Usmanti Community in Mafa LGA of Borno State. Once spotted, the suicide bombers were chased. In the ensuing stampede and an attempt to escape arrest, the bombers hurriedly detonated IEDs strapped on their bodies killing themselves. Two members of the Civilian JTF, who were assisting the military, were injured in the explosion.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces killed 12 members of Boko Haram during a coordinated ambush at Miyanti-Banki junction in Borno. Additionally, two soldiers were reported killed.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces shoot and kills a member of Boko Haram at Kafin Hausa in Madagali Local Government Area of Adamawa.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks a group of fishermen at Guguri and Dabar Wanzam villages ""last weekend"" (source dated 09/07), killing 31. The attackers allowed one of the fishermen to survive, sending him to Baga to tell locals in the area what had happened.
Unknown gunmen on 05/08 shot dead a yet-to-be identified middle-age woman in Osogbo. The incident occurred at about 9.00 am at Old Garage area of Osogbo. The reasons for the attack are not known.
A man in his mid-forties is killed by unknown gunmen that invaded Atongo village in Katsina/Ala Local Government Area of Benue State.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Nigerian army on Sunday [6 August] said it had killed two suspected members of Boko Haram in an ambush along Alagarno forest axis in Borno.
Numbering 10, ""cultists"" attack the palace of the village head of Abak Obong village in Etim Ekpo local council. Two dead, others injured.
Following the attack and killing of a farmer ""last week"" Ikale (Yoruba) farmers protest the act. The exact date of the protest is not known - source dated 06/08.

Unknown gunmen with unknown motive invaded St. Philips Catholic Church located in Umuezekwe, Ofufe-Amakwa, Ozubulu community in Ekwusigo Local Government Area of Anambra State and opened fire on the worshippers during the morning services. 47 reported dead, many others injured. The attackers may have been members of a drug cartel.
The Village Head of Bijeje is killed by unknown gunmen. Several suspects were later arrested.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Nigerian Army said it killed six [members of Boko Haram] and arrested two in Dikwa Local Government Area of Borno during an operation to dislodge the group. The encounter occurred between Bulabirin and Mongole villages.
OMDM protesters gathered in Abuja to demand President Muhammadu Buhari, who has been receiving treatment in London for an undisclosed ailment for more than three months, either return or resign.

APC protesters barricaded the secretariat of the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Bayelsa State, following the alleged expulsion of the party Chairman, Chief Tiwe Oruminighe. The protesters also blocked roads.
Five suspected kidnappers were lynched by a vigilante mob in Tela. A sixth escaped.
Unidentified attackers ambushed a commercial bus in Elibrada in Emohua LGA and abducted 15 passengers. It is noted by the source the area is an oil hub.

Sweepers employed by Dafunol International Limited, a contractor engaged by the Lagos Metropolitan Area Transport Authority (LAMATA), on 07/08 staged a peaceful protest over the non-payment of their five months' salaries.

A anti-Buhari protest led by the Our-Mumu-Don-do Movement at Unity Fountain becomes violent, leading police to disperse the protesters with tear-gas. One reported injury. Later, the OMDM blamed ""hoodlums"" of invading their protest and causing unrest. This was the second day of protest.
A vigilante mob overpowers police along the Lagos-Ibadan Expressway at Ojokoro and set a captured kidnap suspect ablaze.

Scores of residents of Ijeun Community in Obafemi-Owode Local Government Area of Ogun State stormed the Ogun State House of Assembly Complex to demand the removal of a traditional ruler, Olu of Obafe, Oba Taofeek Owolabi, over his alleged land grabbing and criminal activities The protesters carried placards.
A vigilante mob attacks a suspected ritual killer at a bus stop before being rescued by police.
Commercial motorcyclists protested in Ondo City against an order by the police against carrying more than one passenger.

A two day clash between farmers and Fulani herders at Akpagodogbo, Otukpa Local Government Area of Benue State causes three deaths. Sources from the area disclosed that trouble started when some cattle belonging to Fulani herders invaded some farms and ate up all the crops in the farms.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: ""Many"" dead and 60 houses destroyed following a Boko Haram attack on Ghumbili in Madagali LGA. The attack lasted from 11 p.m. on Wednesday to 3 a.m. on Thursday.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces on 09/08 announced they had carried out a series of airstrikes on a Boko Haram logistics base at Parisu in the Sambisa general area. Several buildings were destroyed and ""scores"" killed in the strike. The exact date of the strike was not reported by the source.

Unidentified gunmen attack the home of the former APC governor of Bayelsa in Yenagoa during the early morning hours. The former acting governor sustained injuries. The gunmen were said to have been repelled by security operatives and youths, living in some flats in the compound. Source dated 09/08.
1,000 youths of Nkwelle-Ezunaka community in Oyi Local Government Area of Anambra state, took to the major roads in protest against what they termed alleged plot to remove their town union executive.
Pensioners in Niger State protest in Minna over non-payment of stipends.
OMDM's anti-Buhari protest enters its third day. No reported violence.
Anti-Buhari protesters gather at Unity Fountain for a fourth day. Pro-Buhari counter protesters were also present. No reported violence.
A pro Buhari counter protest in Abuja continues into Aso.

column7: ANLCA: Association of Nigerian Licensed Customs Agents
column17: Association of Nigerian Licensed Customs Agents (ANLCA) protest at Tin-Can Island and Apapa ports over an operating of a fee.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: ""Many"" dead and 60 houses destroyed following a Boko Haram attack on Ghumbili in Madagali LGA. The attack lasted from 11 p.m. on Wednesday to 3 a.m. on Thursday.

column7: ANLCA: Association of Nigerian Licensed Customs Agents
column17: Association of Nigerian Licensed Customs Agents (ANLCA) protest at Tin-Can Island and Apapa ports over an operating of a fee.

A two day clash between farmers and Fulani herders at Akpagodogbo, Otukpa Local Government Area of Benue State causes three deaths. Sources from the area disclosed that trouble started when some cattle belonging to Fulani herders invaded some farms and ate up all the crops in the farms.
Pro and anti-protests occur at unity fountain. Security forces were deployed to avert a violent clash.
A vigilante mob set two scavengers ablaze mistaking them for ritualists. The attack took place at Zik bus stop in Ikeja.
Protesters ""shut down"" and ""occupy"" Shell petroleum plants in Kula and Belema in protest of company neglect toward the local community.
Protesters ""shut down"" and ""occupy"" Shell petroleum plants in Kula and Belema in protest of company neglect toward the local community.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: No fewer than four persons were killed in an attack by Boko Haram insurgents at Wanori-Amarwa community of Konduga local government area of Borno. The News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) reports that the incident occurred on Saturday at about 11: 00 PM at a village along Maiduguri-Konduga Road.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two tractor drivers were killed by Boko Haram insurgents in Jere Local Government Area of Borno. The attack occurred ""in the last few days"" (source dated 13/08).
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.

Some Ozubulu youths under the auspices of Ozubulu Youths Association protested the re-opening of St. Philips Catholic Church, Amakwa Ozubulu, Anambra State. President of the association said it was worrisome that the church would be re-opened for service when investigations into the matter had not been concluded or even the victims buried.
The village Head of Ikot-Obot in Cross River State was reportedly killed by a group of persons suspected to be hired assassins in Bakassi Local Government Area of the state, weekend.

Anti-Buhari protesters continue in Abuja until 16/08. On 15/08 pro-Buhari counter protesters attacked several members of the anti-Buhari group, including their leader ""Charley Boy,"" nearly lynching them. No causalities.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.

Anti-Buhari protesters continue in Abuja until 16/08. On 15/08 pro-Buhari counter protesters attacked several members of the anti-Buhari group, including their leader ""Charley Boy,"" nearly lynching them. No causalities.
After a soldier hit a street trader with a motorbike, a vigilante group attacked the trooper killing him. Police made several arrests.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Residents of Ijebu Ijesa on 15/08 embarked on a protest to denounce one year power outage in their community by Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company (IBEDC).
An operative of the Edo State Command of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC) was assassinated at his home in Benin by unidentified gunmen. The reason for the attack is not known.
Four men have been lynched by youths at Tella in Gassol Local Government of Taraba State. Eyewitnesses said the deceased were suspected kidnappers.
Protest over a state budget that includes funds for the governor's house.

Seven days after gunmen killed many worshippers at a Catholic Church in Ozubulu, unidentified killed a policeman and a commercial bike rider near the Assemblies of God Church in Onitsha. The two attacks may be related.

Seven days after gunmen killed many worshippers at a Catholic Church in Ozubulu, unidentified persons killed a policeman and a commercial bike rider near the Assemblies of God Church in Onitsha. The two attacks may be related.

Anti-Buhari protesters continue in Abuja until 16/08. On 14/08, Buhari supporters gather at the Presidential Villa in protest of recent efforts to oust him. On 15/08 pro-Buhari counter protesters attacked several members of the anti-Buhari group, including their leader ""Charley Boy,"" nearly lynching them. No causalities.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Looting: Suspected members of Boko Haram the night of 14/08 attacked two Adamawa communities, burning houses and looting foodstuffs. The communities involved were Nyibango and Muduhu, both in Madagali Local Government Area of Adamawa State. No reported loss of life.
Hundreds stage a counter pro-Buhari protest to recent anti-Buhari protests in Abuja.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Iyede Kingdom villagers barricade Ughelli-Asaba expressway over recent herdsmen attacks.

Anti-Buhari protests continue in Abuja until 16/08. On 15/08 pro-Buhari counter protesters attacked several members of the anti-Buhari group, including their leader ""Charley Boy,"" nearly lynching them. No causalities.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Agreement: The Nigerian Army on 24/08 said 68 Boko Haram insurgents surrendered to troops in Borno in the last three weeks.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three suicide bombers attacked a displaced persons camp at Mandarari, in Konduga, near Maiduguri, killing between 16 - 28 and wounding 82.
Hospital patients protest insecurity following a recent robbery in the building.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces ambush a group of Boko Haram at Maza in Mafa LGA, killing 10. The ambush occurred during the evening hours.
A mob of five lynch a suspected kidnapper in Oshodi. The perpetrators were later arrested.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces attack a group of Boko Haram fighters in Marte LGA, kill ten.
Thousands of members of the Islamic Movement in Nigeria (IMN) took to the streets in Kaduna, calling for the immediate release of their leader, Sheikh Ibraheem Zakzaky.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Forty-two farmers from Aliero town, Aliero Local Government Area of Kebbi State have reportedly been killed by Boko Haram insurgents when they travelled to Borno State for farming duties. Date and location of attacks not known. Authorities confirmed the attack on 16/08.

Members of the Independent People of Biafra (IPOB) clashed with the police in Ekwulobia, Aguata Local Council of Anambra State. The incident followed an earlier plan by the leader of IPOB, Nnamdi Kanu, to hold a rally at Ekwulobia as part of his campaign to stop Anambra State gubernatorial election.

Anti-Buhari protesters continue in Abuja until 16/08. On 15/08 pro-Buhari counter protesters attacked several members of the anti-Buhari group, including their leader ""Charley Boy,"" nearly lynching them. No causalities.

Unidentified gunmen attacked the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission in Abuja, but were repelled by guards. As the attackers were fleeing one dropped an envelope containing a death threat against Ishaku Sharu, a senior investigator with the commission. Ishaku heads the foreign exchange malpractices fraud section is in charge of corruption investigation involving several politically exposed persons and retired military officers.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Teachers boycott and protest a government mandated competency exam.
Fish sellers protest taxes in Calabar.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: As reported on 18 August 2017, a local armed group of hunters repelled an attack by Boko Haram on Bakin Dutse and Gadamayo villages in Madagali (Adamawa), killing two top insurgents commander in the process.

Two persons were on 18/08 killed while several others were injured following the invasion of the secretariat of the All Progressive Congress (APC) in Bayelsa State by some armed ""hired thugs"" to disrupt the inauguration of the new Acting Chairman of the party.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Pro-Buhari protest in Kaduna on 19/04.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram kidnapped six children in Biu LGA.

Clashes ""at the weekend"" between militias of the villages of Igbide and Okpolo-Enwhe of Isoko South LGA cause six deaths, scores wounded and several houses set ablaze. The clash was over the control of land.

The home of a police officer and a pastor are firebombed by Usumutong militia. It was stated the attack was retaliation for an earlier attack (specifics not given). The pastor was killed in the attack.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.

Unknown gunmen were alleged to have shot and killed the former chairman of the outlawed Community Development Association, CDA, of Oghoghobi village near Benin at his residence on Sunday morning. The attack led to a violent protest among area youths.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: An explosive device suspected to have been planted by Boko Haram militants has killed two people and injured three others along Damaturu - Biu road, Yobe State. The incident happened about 4:45pm close to Azare village.
Unidentified gunmen killed the senior aid to Governor Samuel Ortom.

Unknown gunmen were alleged to have shot and killed the former chairman of the outlawed Community Development Association, CDA, of Oghoghobi village near Benin at his residence on Sunday morning. The attack led to a violent protest among area youths.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.
Protesters occupy petroleum plants in Kula and Belema from 11/08-20/18.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two livestock traders were killed and three seriously injured after triggering a mine as they fled Boko Haram along the Biu-Damaturu highway.
Pro-Buhari protest in Kaduna on 21/04. This was the second gathering of supporters in Kaduna in three days.
""Pandemoum"" as youths and traders fight on 22/08 in Isolo. Details not known.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram jihadists killed six men in Kijimatari (near Monguno) in an early morning attack. The attackers broke into the victim's homes, slitting their throats. The attack is believed to be a reprisal.
A small boy is nearly lynched on suspicion of theft.
Workers of the Federal Ministry of Environment, Abuja, staged a peaceful protest at the front of the ministry over the alleged reduction of the forthcoming Sallah allowances by the ministry.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: Members of the Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees (NULGE) across Ondo state gathered at Akure to throw their weight behind local government autonomy in the country. The protesters marched through Oyemekun road, through Arakale road, displaying placards with various inscriptions as they sang solidarity songs to press home their demands before heading to the state House of Assembly complex.
Buhari blocked major roads in Kaduna metropolis and its environs celebrating the return of President Muhammad Buhari to the country.

After gunmen killed a youth chairman of the Ohoghobi community, villagers protest violently, burning the place of the local traditional ruler. A source said the villagers suspected the monarch to be the mastermind of the killing, as he had threatened him previously.

After gunmen killed a youth chairman of the Ohoghobi community, villagers protest violently, burning the place of the local traditional ruler. A source said the villagers suspected the monarch to be the mastermind of the killing, as he had threatened him previously.

A local vigilance operative attached to Okpoko community in Ogbaru Local Council of Anambra State was attacked and killed by a group of youths in the area over a protracted leadership crisis in the community. It is not known if the victim was armed.
Following a road collision, Oka youths set one of the involved vehicle, a truck, ablaze believing the driver responsible.
After a ""ritual killer"" escaped police custody, residents protest ""police complicity.""

column7: PACI: People Against Corruption and Injustice
column17: People Against Corruption and Injustice protest against the billing practices of a local cable provider in the area. During the protest an errant drive struck the group killing two and injuring fifteen. The collision is believe to be accidental.
Farmers, mainly from Igoba community in Akure North protest against herdsmen's activates in the area. The farmers claimed the grazing was destroying their farmland.
The two factions of the BCO, a pro-Buhari campaign organization clashed in a supremacy tussle during a rally to celebrate the return of the President from London following a medical procedure.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks several villages in Guzamala LGA, killing 12 people.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks several villages in Nganzai LGA, killing 15 people.

After two women are raped by Fulanis in Ore, youths from Ondo state under the auspices of Ondo State Youth Coalition (OSYC) and farmers across the 18 local government area of the state on 23/08 protested against the act. The protesting youths ago report a murder, though this may have occurred earlier in the month. The location of the protest demonstration is not known. The date of the assault is not known.

After two women are raped by Fulanis in Ore, youths from Ondo state under the auspices of Ondo State Youth Coalition (OSYC) and farmers across the 18 local government area of the state on 23/08 protested against the act. The protesting youths ago report a murder, though this may have occurred earlier in the month. The location of the protest demonstration is not known. The date of the assault is not known.
An unidentified suicide bomber attacked a military outpost in Maiduguri, killing six and injuring a civilian.
After a flood victim drowns, area residents protest in the Lokogoma area of the FCT.
A group protests against violence against women along the Lekki-Epe Expressway and ""major streets in the area.""

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Property destruction: Members of the Boko Haram sect burnt down Bayan Dutse and Kubu communities of Madagali Local Government Area of Adamawa State. The raiders also took food aid intended for Bayan Dutse. No reported loss of life or injury.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Property destruction: Members of the Boko Haram sect burnt down Bayan Dutse and Kubu communities of Madagali Local Government Area of Adamawa State. The raiders also took food aid intended for Bayan Dutse. No reported loss of life or injury.

column7: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
column17: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) protest admission marks in Bwari on 24/08.
A vigilante mob burn a church building after they suspect the pastor of murdering an 11 year old. No reported injuries.
Assassins killed the Okpe PDP chairman in his residence. Three were later arrested.
Exasperated by Boko Haram attacks, 400+ hbts of Madina and Boulo (Logone&Chari) conducted a raid in Nigeria territory
Fulanis cut off a farmer's fingers in Nkanu West LGA.
In response to a firebomb attack on the home of a police officer and a pastor by Usumutong militia, militia from Ediba attacked Usumutong, killing nine and destroying houses.

Traders protest the government closing of Eke Onunwa market in Owerri. Police fired in the air to disperse the protesters, errantly killing a young boy. Angered, the protesters battled the police, causing two additional deaths.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Agreement: Boko Haram commander Auwal Ismaeela, who was involved in the abduction of the 'Chibok Girls' surrenders to Nigerian forces in Madagali. Exact date not known; source dated 27/08.

Scores of women took to the streets and barricaded the Effurun roundabout axis of the East-West Road in protest over an alleged land-grab and sale of about 185.20 hectares of property at Uvwie, Uvwie Local Council of Delta State by the Nigerian Army. The protest began at 6am and lasted three hours.

Gunmen ambushed and killed four soldiers and a civilian as they travelled near Letugbene. The group was first captured, marched elsewhere, then executed. Military leadership later claimed only two deaths.

""Charly Boy"" on 28/08 led the ""Our Mumu Don Do"" Movement to the headquarters of EFCC, in Abuja to demand the extradition of Diezani Allison-Madueke from the United Kingdom for trial over corruption allegations. The protest lasted into the following day (29/08).
Residents protest the state destruction of homes in Lagoon Estate, Ikorodu. The protest took place in Alausa.

Unknown gunmen have abducted eleven passengers in a bus on Ndele-Elele axis of East-West road, Emohua Local Government Area of Rivers State on the night of 28/08. The motives of the kidnapping arte not yet clear.
Academic and non-academic staff of the Federal Polytechnic, Bauchi stage a protest, accusing the rector of ""highhandedness.""

""Charly Boy"" on 28/08 led the ""Our Mumu Don Do"" Movement to the headquarters of EFCC, in Abuja to demand the extradition of Diezani Allison-Madueke from the United Kingdom for trial over corruption allegations. The protest lasted into the following day (29/08).
Citizens of Aba North Local Government Area of Abia State staged a protest at INEC state headquarters in Umuahia over the proposed relocation of a government office.
A large pro-Buhari rally is held in Bauchi on 29/08.
Residents of an IDP camp in Maiduguri violently protest over poor food quality.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: 2,000 NULGE protesters gathered along the Ogoja Expressway in Abakaliki to call for more local autonomy. The protesters blocked the road and entrance to the government house. Pensioners were also protesting in the city the same day.
A protest for and against the demolition becomes violent, leading to a shootout between the two groups. Three injuries reported.

Over 200 pensioners blocked the entrance of Ebonyi State Government House to protest what they termed as ""ill treatment meted to them"" by officials of the government handling their verification exercise. A second NULGE protest occurred elsewhere in the city on the same day.
A 'lunatic,' suspected member of a kidnap and ritualist gang was set ablaze by a mob, following the discovery of the gang's den in Mushin area of Lagos. Five were later arrested.
Hundreds of casual workers at the Federal Medical Centre, Owo, Ondo State began a protest on 30/08 over unpaid entitlements of about 18 months. The protesters blocked the entrance to the hospital.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Arrests: Military forces arrest Hussein Mai-Tangaran, a top commander of Boko Haram in Kano on 31/07. It is reported the arrest led to other arrests.

A group of Ijaw youths staged a protest to the headquarters of the Nigerian Content Development and Monitoring Board (NCDMB) in Yenagoa, accusing it of operating ""without meaningful impact for the people of the Niger Delta region. ""

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Around 31 August 2017, military forces announced that they had ""neutralized"" five Boko Haram commanders and ""many"" (coded as 10) of their foot soldiers during operations in the north-east Borno. The commanders names included Abu Dujana, Man Tahiru, Man Chari, Malam Abdullahi Abu Sa'ad and Goni Bamanga. The date(s) of the operation are not known. The operation was jointly conducted with air forces. Abubakar Shekau released a video shortly after the strike denying the military's claims.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks and kills 21 farmers in the Damboa region over two non-consecutive days; 17 at Bula Buba and Tawarmada villages on 31/08 and four at Mirimari village on 02/09.
Following a road accident which killed three commercial motorcyclists, the victim's colleagues protest the incident.

Following the attack on a group of soldiers outside Letugbene, military squads retaliate against Letugbene and Bilbri towns, destroying homes and forcing residents to flee. The date(s) of these operations are not entirely known - source dated 01/09.

Following the attack on a group of soldiers outside Letugbene, military squads retaliate against Letugbene and Bilbri towns, destroying homes and forcing residents to flee. The date(s) of these operations are not entirely known - source dated 01/09.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 1 September 2017, three Boko Haram commanders and deputies to Abubakar Shekau (Afdu Kawuri and Abubakar Banishek and Modu Bako) were killed in military operations at Alafa (Gwoza, Borno) on Sallah day.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Air forces destroy Boko Haram camps in Garin Maloma area in Sambisa Forest, neutralizing ""hundreds."" It is believed Boko Haram in the targeted location were planning to disrupt Eid-el Kabir celebrations in the area.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack an IDP camp in Banki, killing 11.
Two police officers are nearly lynched ""at the weekend"" by a vigilante group accusing them of theft.
A farmer was ""at the weekend"" attacked and killed by Fulani herdsmen.
Gunmen attack Amatu community ""at the weekend"" shooting sporadically and abduction one civilian.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks and kills 21 farmers in the Damboa region over two non-consecutive days; 17 at Bula Buba and Tawarmada villages on 31/08 and four at Mirimari village on 02/09.
After a police officer extrajudicially shot and killed an Emir, locals violently protest the act, fighting the police.
After a police officer extrajudicially shot and killed an Emir, locals violently protest the act, fighting the police.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram ambush and kill four farmers in Bulamari, outside of Maiduguri.
Tricycle (Keke) operators clash with military forces in Umuahia for unknown reason. Several of the Keke operators were later arrested and charged with riotous assembly.
