""Delta Militants"" attack a police checkpoint and a nearby station and steal weapons. A sergeant was killed and two civilians, attempting to aid the police officer, were injured.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces ambush a group of Boko Haram in Banki, killing ""a large number."" Several others were wounded.
A vigilante mob beats a 70-year-old to death for alleged witchcraft on 05/09.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Air forces launch strikes against Boko Haram positions in the Sambisia Forest on consecutive days between 06/09 and 10/09. Many locations not reported; Njimia was struck on 10/09. Causalities not known; structures ""destroyed.""

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacked Mallan village near Maiduguri on the evening of 06/09. Three reported dead. The attack was an apparent reprisal after several locals joined an area militia. Boko Haram also attacked Kesa Kura in coordination with this strike.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Air forces launch strikes against Boko Haram positions in the Sambisia Forest on consecutive days between 06/09 and 10/09. Many locations not reported; Njimia was struck on 10/09. Causalities not known; structures ""destroyed.""
Unidentified gunmen abducted 20 bus travellers in Isiokpo.
Nineteen are dead following a Fulani attack on Ancha, a village in Maingo, Bassa Local Government Area. The attack came during the evening hours.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Air forces bomb Boko Haram areas in Zanari, which borders Lake Chad. An ""unknown number"" were believed to have been killed.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 17 Boko Haram fighters stormed Mallan village (near Maiduguri) at about 8:00 am (0700 GMT) on Thursday (07/09), killing two farmers. The group attack the village the previous evening as well. The attacks were an apparent reprisal after several locals joined an area militia.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least seven people were killed when Boko Haram attacked an IDP camp in Ngala. The attack began with RPG fire followed by sustained gunfire.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two suicide bombers attack Muna Garage area. The bombers were reported dead, five other injuries.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A group of ""local hunters and vigilantes"" battle Boko Haram in Buni Tadi area. Two Boko Haram deaths reported, six injuries, weapons recovered and 13 hostages released. Six of the hostages were believed to be children who were abducted in Biu LGA on 19/08.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Air forces launch strikes against Boko Haram positions in the Sambisia Forest on consecutive days between 06/09 and 10/09. Many locations not reported; Njimia was struck on 10/09. Causalities not known; structures ""destroyed.""
Militias from Ugbo and Ugbonla clash in Ugbonla over a chieftaincy tussle. One death reported.

Soldiers, police and members of IPOB clash in Umuahia after soldiers attacked the home of an IPOB leader in the city, killing five. The military denied this report, stating that IPOB members blocked a road and threw objects at police. IPOB, however, claimed the attack on the leader's home was an unprovoked attack. A late report by the Guardian claims 15 were killed in a battle between the two sides at the home of the leader.
After a restaurant patron dies of food poisoning a ""mob"" gathers outside the establishment before they were dispersed by police.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces ambush a Boko Haram contingent along Ngurosoye-Bama road, neutralizing a ""large number"" and recovering equipment. Several soldiers were reported wounded.
Militias from Ugbo and Ugbonla clash in Ugbonla clash for a second day. Injuries reported.
Activists burn a coffin in Lagos to express dissatisfaction with the call for Nigeria's separation and restructuring. Date not known, source dated 10/09.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Air forces launch strikes against Boko Haram positions in the Sambisia Forest on consecutive days between 06/09 and 10/09. Many locations not reported; Njimia was struck on 10/09. Causalities not known; structures ""destroyed.""

Aggrieved shareholders protested the Annual General Meeting of Oando Plc at Ibom Hall in Uyo, Akwa Ibom State with placards demanding the resignation of the company's Group Chief Executive Officer over mismanagement.

11 September. Military forces reportedly killed 180 members of the Igbo ethnicity during operations against Biafra in Asa, Aba, Umahia, and Isiala-Ngwa. This was reported by an organization who identified seven mass graves, thought to contain some of those killed during the operation. The total fatalities were disaggregated by location.

11 September. Military forces reportedly killed 180 members of the Igbo ethnicity during operations against Biafra in Asa, Aba, Umahia, and Isiala-Ngwa. This was reported by an organization who identified seven mass graves, thought to contain some of those killed during the operation. The total fatalities were disaggregated by location.
Youths barricade the office of an oil company. The group was protesting the company's refusal to relocate its head office from Lagos to Akwa Ibom State.

11 September. Military forces reportedly killed 180 members of the Igbo ethnicity during operations against Biafra in Asa, Aba, Umahia, and Isiala-Ngwa. This was reported by an organization who identified seven mass graves, thought to contain some of those killed during the operation. The total fatalities were disaggregated by location.

11 September. Military forces reportedly killed 180 members of the Igbo ethnicity during operations against Biafra in Asa, Aba, Umahia, and Isiala-Ngwa. This was reported by an organization who identified seven mass graves, thought to contain some of those killed during the operation. The total fatalities were disaggregated by location. The report did not specify if the attacks were in Isiala Ngwa North or South so the location is approximate.
Military forces kill five suspects involved in the attack on Ancha on 07/09.

Soldiers invaded the Secretariat of the Abia State Council of Nigerian Union of Journalists at No. 1 Aba Road Umuahia and assaulted some journalists over articles written critical of the military. The soldiers held the journalists hostage for 10 minutes.
Midwives protest in Asokoro, Abuja over non-payment of allowances.

Some members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) on 12/09 clashed with the Hausa community in Oyibo Local Government Area of Rivers State. Several injuries reported, buildings destroyed. IPOB instigated the attack by entering a Hausa area, threatening to burn down a mosque.

Thousands of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) being accommodated at the International Market Camp, Makurdi on 12/09 protested alleged diversion of relief materials by camp officials. The protesters overpowered security guards at the camp, and blocked the camp entrance to prevent the vehicles from moving out with the materials.
Residents block the entrance of the Maritime Academy of Nigeria, Oron in protest of a leadership appointment.

Four persons, including a retired Major and a former PDP state chairmen were reportedly killed in a conflict between supporters of All Progressives Congress, APC, and PDP, at Ondo community, in Ogobia, Ugboju District of Otukpo Local Government Area of Benue state. The melee stemmed from a rivalry of the Otukpo council chairman position.
Members of IPOB attacked and killed a police officer and injured two others in Oyigbo LGA. The attack was related to a clash in the area the previous day.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: ""A contracted truck driver transporting UN commodities was shot by suspected Bobo-Haram fighters along the Dikwa-Maiduguri road. Despite the injury, he managed to drive to Dikwa.""

Retired military officers on the platform of the Coalition of Concerned Veterans (CCV) protested at the Federal Ministry of Finance to demand end to illegal deduction from their pensions. The ex-military officers barricaded the main entrance of the ministry.
Security forces ""foil"" an attempt by suspected Biafran secessionists to burn a market and police station. Extent of damage not known. The perpetrators continued violence the following day.
Former airline workers protest unpaid severance package at Lagos Airport. The protested blocked a road nearby.

""Four members of a UN agency were seriously assaulted by soldiers that had entered their residential compound in Monguno. The soldiers were making their rounds to enforce curfew when the attack occurred, reportedly because the soldiers found that some contracted staff were in violation of the regulations. They forced the staff inside and proceeded to make their way through the house, waking other staff up and assaulting or threatening them. Three contracted drivers and one staff member were physically hurt in the attack.""

Unsubstantiated reports of ""shootings and killings"" throughout the city of Aba following an attack by rioters on a police station. Injuries, fatalities not numbers by source. The perpetrators may be Biafran secessionists.

Two persons said to be members of IPOB, were reportedly shot dead by military forces along Bank Road in Umuahia, while another person sustained bullet injuries while coming out from the nearby branch of Zenith Bank. At the time of the attack the members of IPOB were participating in a protest against the military. No report of protester violence.

Following rumours that soldiers had killed a number of residents of Umuode and burnt their homes, unidentified youths attacked a Aba police station and set it alight. Police used tear gas against the rioters. Soldiers attacking residents may have been related to tensions related to Biafran secessionists in the area. There were unsubstantiated reports of killings and shootings in different parts of the city; causality numbers not known, coded as 3.

Following rumours that soldiers had killed ""a number"" of residents of Umuode and burnt their homes, unidentified youths attacked a Aba police station and set it alight. Police used tear gas against the rioters. Soldiers attacking residents may have been related to tensions related to Biafran secessionists in the area. There were unsubstantiated reports of killings and shootings in different parts of the city; causality numbers not known.
A University of Jos student, mistaken for Igbo, is attacked and killed by a group of anti-IPOB protesters.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Agreement: The Borno State police command has said that over 13 members of Boko Haram including a top Commander of the sect, named Ibrahim Dala (alias Abu Ali) , formerly of Kawar Mela ward, of Maiduguri and an Amir of the Mamman Nur faction of the Boko Haram surrendered to the intelligence arm of its police anti-robbery squad following a peaceful negotiation.

Soldiers raid the family home of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) leader, Mazi Nnamdi Kanu, in Afaraukwu, Abia State, around 5.00 p.m. on 14/09. The soldiers on arrival shot sporadically for about 40 minutes that the invasion lasted. It is not known if the owners of the home defended themselves. The house was reported destroyed. Causalities not known. The operation led to further unrest in the area.

The traditional ruler of Obollo autonomous community in Isiala Mbano Local Government Area of Imo State is attacked and nearly lynched after a unfavourable political appointment was made on the ruler's behalf.

column7: EYCDA: Elete Youth Community Development Association
column17: A youth coalition (EYCDA) within Elete Kingdom has protests against the alleged imposition of a ruler against their wishes.

Unidentified persons, suspected to be IPOB (Igbo) attacked a Hausa settlement in Asaba, killing four. The attack began with a failed bomb attack on a mosque. In a separate attack elsewhere in the city IBOB killed two in a market.

Three persons, including a Police officer and an expatriate, have been killed in Kogi State along the Ajaokuta-Lokoja Highway by suspected kidnappers. Gathered that the expat, who was travelling with one of his staff, ran into the gunmen that had laid an ambush to kidnap him, but were resisted by the Police escorts.
Unidentified gunmen have shot dead a police inspector, commander of Kaduna state vigilante group and abducted two young girls at Unguwar Katsinawa, Shika, Giwa local government area of Kaduna state.
Youths, wearing Igbo attire protest for ethnic peace in Nigeria. The protest took place at an unknown location in Kano State.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected members of Boko Haram invaded Kurmiri village of Titiwa Ward in which the attackers killed the Chief Imam of the village alongside four other persons.

Hundreds of cars and several other valuables were destroyed at Rumuekini Community, Obio/Akpor Local Government Area of Rivers State, following the discovery of the remains of the Chairman of People Democratic Party, PDP, in Ogbogoro Ward 15. The information surrounding the death of the Ward Chair (date and perpetrators) are not known.

Hundreds of cars and several other valuables were destroyed at Rumuekini Community, Obio/Akpor Local Government Area of Rivers State, following the discovery of the remains of one Mr. Heaven Ihuigwe, Chairman of People Democratic Party, PDP, in Ogbogoro Ward 15. The information surrounding the death of the Ward Chair is not known.
Students of the College of Education, Ikere Ekiti, on Monday went on a ""rampage"" following alleged rape of a female student by a commercial driver.

Unidentified assailants kidnap two soldiers and four civilians in Rivers State on 18/09. It is not clear if the rescued military personnel were kidnapped for ransom or negotiating leverage for the perpetrators. The group was rescued on 21/09.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram suicide bombers have reportedly killed at least 15, others injured. It was gathered that the attack occurred at Mashimari, Konduga, outside Maiduguri. This Day reports the deaths of 12.

Arrests: Security forces announced they had arrested 59 members of IPOB in Abia State on 18/09. The date(s) of operation not known. Per a recent government declaration the arrested will be tried for terrorism.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces repel Boko Haram attacks at Beta and Pulka; 2 in Beta, 16 in Pulka.
Scores of stakeholders of Oando Plc from across South Western States protested in Ibadan protesting alleged N263billion liability of the company.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces repel Boko Haram attacks at Beta and Pulka; 2 in Beta, 16 in Pulka.
At the Ilorin International Airport ATSSAN and NUATE members protested the concession of some airports by the federal government. The airport workers blocked roads.

column7: NUEE: National Union of Electricity Employees
column17: NUEE employees protest in front of the Alausa office over labour issues.

column7: ATSSSAN: Air Transport Services Senior Staff Association; NUATE: National Union of Air Transport Employees
column17: Workers of the Federal Airports Authority of Nigeria (FAAN) under the aegis of the Air Transport Service Senior Staff Association (ATSSSAN) and the National Union of Air Transport Employees (NUATE) staged a protest to express their disapproval of plans by the federal government to concession the Lagos and Abuja Airports.
Soldiers kill a farmer for riding a motorcycle after an area ban on the vehicle had been put in place.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram kills nine at an IDP camp in Rann on 20/09.

The Joint Task Force, Operation DELTA SAFE (ODS) has raided a militants camp at Obiozimini, Ogba-Egbema- Ndoni Local Government Area of Rivers state and rescued six kidnapped victims including two soldiers. Some of the perpetrators were reported wounded. The victims were abducted on 18 September.

Unidentified gunmen on 21/09 invaded the Tsafe Command of the Federal Road Safety Corps, FRSC, in Zamfara, killing an official. Area security operatives mobilized following the attack, killing one of the perpetrators.

Unidentified gunmen on 21/09 invaded the Tsafe Command of the Federal Road Safety Corps, FRSC, in Zamfara, killing an official. Area security operatives mobilized following the attack, killing one of the perpetrators.

""Hoodlums"" disrupt an APC meeting, attacking the APC Osun state Commissioner for Regional Integration - beating and stripping him. Additionally, rocks were thrown at APC supporters outside the venue.

column7: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Security and Civil Defence Corps
column17: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed two police officers and one NSCDC operative while they were on patrol near an oil facility in Tebidaba.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces kill two members of Boko Haram near Feri-Feri and Tashan Goto axis in Bama on 22/09.

At least 10 people were arrested after thousands of people uprooted from their homes by the Boko Haram insurgency protested in Dalori. The group was arrested after they ignored orders to disperse and return to their camps. The protesters were calling for better food, water and healthcare.

Residents of Omun-Ekiti protest after a favoured politician is suspended from the government assembly. The lawmaker was believed to have been suspended for refusing to renounce his association and loyalty to his political benefactor.

Three policemen providing security at the Ogba Zoo were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be kidnappers. The attackers abducted the director of the park. The perpetrators took the officer's weapons and fled.

Three policemen providing security at the Ogba Zoo were shot dead by gunmen suspected to be kidnappers. The attackers abducted the director of the park. The perpetrators took the officer's weapons and fled.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Kurmiri village of Titiwa Ward, Magumeri LGA on the night of 24/09 killing an Imam and 20 others.

On 25 September 2017, former Secretary to Oyo state government, three correspondents and others were nearly assassinated as gunmen attacked the Olubadan palace, Popoyemoja, Ibadan, shortly before the installation of some Baales. The reason for the attack is not known. Following the attack one of the suspects were nearly lynched by a vigilante group.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suicide bomber killed five people on 26/09 in a mosque in northeast Nigeria at Dikwa. Boko Haram are believed to be responsible.

The women's wing of Isoko Development Union, IDU, protests against warring Igbide and Okpolo-Enwhe communities in Isoko South Local Government Area, Delta State, demanding an end to hostilities. The protest took place in Igbide.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram killed three people and set fire to 150 homes in a raid targeting rural communities in Guzamala local government area. The villages included in the attack were Goram and two neighbouring villages, Lingis and Ajidari.
ACR retirees gather in Asaba to call on the Delta State governor to pay stipends.
Two are dead after a convoy of civilian vehicles hit a pair of landmines on the Mafa to Dikwa road in Borno state, near Koibe. There were several other injuries. Perpetrators are yet unknown.
After a cement truck struck a group of students (accidentally) killing seven, other students barricaded the Abuja-Lokoja highway in protest.
Private schools owners in Abakaliki, Ebonyi State protested the closure of their schools by suspected agents of the state government. The protesters numbered 60.
Gunmen abducted a top Zamfara State police officer and three members of his family on a remote area of Birnin-Gwari-Funtua road on 27/09. The officer was likely not on duty at the time of attack.

column7: DESOPADEC: Delta State Oil Producing Areas Development Commission
column17: Contractors to Delta State Oil Producing Areas Development Commission, DESOPADEC, staged a peaceful protest to DESOPADEC Head Office in Warri, demanding the payment of their accumulated debts.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces kill two members of Boko Haram and recover weapons in Malamti, Guzamala LGA. Two of the soldiers were injured in the exchange.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A police personnel and an Internally Displaced Person were killed on the evening of 29/09, in crossfire between military troops and Boko Haram in Bocobs, Bama.

Over 500 retirees from the Delta Civil Service, organized under ACR, matched through major roads in Asaba in protest against non-payment of their pensions and gratuity by the state government for the past six years. A similar protest took place two days prior.
Unknown gunmen attacked Gyangyang village in Jhar Chiefdom of Kanam Local Government area of Plateau state, killing the acting village head. The attack occurred during the early morning hours.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Nigerian Army killed one Boko Haram member after repelling an attack by the insurgents at Bocos village in Bama Local Government Area, Borno State.

column7: BIHD: Bama Initiative for Human Development
column17: The Bama Initiative for Human Development, an NGO, on 01/10 in Maiduguri staged a peaceful demonstration demanding the return of Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) to their respective communities in Bama.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: No fewer than four soldiers of Operation Lafiya Dole were killed with another senior officer and a driver, escaping unhurt when some Boko Haram insurgents ambushed the operational vehicle conveying food for troops along Mafa-Sasawa Military Base in Borno State.
Students of Moshood Abiola Polytechnic protest at the office of the rector over the state of education in Ogun.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces kill four members of Boko Haram in Bama LGA was the sect attempted two separate attacks on an IDP camp in the area. The two attacks occurred at different times of the day.
Three suspected robbers were lynched by youths when they robbed the residence of one Abdulmumini Daga and three others in Daga village, Jibia Local Government Area of Katsina State.
A suspected thief is beaten to death by a vigilante mob in Amorji Nike, Abakpa in Enugu East.

Gunmen (suspected 'cultists') have killed at least two persons and injured scores, when they invaded Mgbuoshimini Community in Obio/Akpor Local Government Area of Rivers State, on the night of 05/10. It is believed the attackers targeted the town in search of rivals.
Gunmen kidnap a magistrate near Salem University on the evening of 05/10.
NLC airline workers protest at Lagos airport over labour concerns.
NLC holds a demonstration against the 'casualization of workers.'

column7: NDNYLA: Niger Delta Non-Violence Youth Leaders Assembly
column17: Hundreds of NDNYLA protesters stormed the premises of the Nigeria Union of Journalists in Port Harcourt demanding the redeployment of the Commander of Special Anti Robbery squad. The protesters alleged the Commander provided poor security and was corrupt.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces neutralize two members of Boko Haram at Mayanti, Bama LGA. The event occurred late in the evening hours on 06/10.
On 6 October 2017, Islamic State claims to have killed 30 Nigerian soldiers in north-east Borno state. The military denied any such attack took place.
Students of a Polytechnic school violently protest after two students died of maleria on 06/10.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces kill three members of Boko Haram at Madari, Borno State on 08/10. Premium Times claims Boko Haram were intercepted in Lingir village.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces kills a Boko Haram cattle rustler at Kirbiri, Gujba LGA. Several others escaped with injuries.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: NURTW protesters engage in running battles with police over the detention of their leader. The protest carried on into the following day.

column7: NDAN: Newspaper Distributors Association of Nigeria; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: Police forces arrest a group of newspaper vendors who were using their stand to promote the Indigenous People of Biafra. Following the arrest, colleagues of the NDAN staged a protest against the intimidation. Date of both events not known - occurred on or before 09/10.
Kaduna police officers protest non-payment of salaries.

The Enugu State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) protested President Muhammadu Buhari's appointment of some indigenes of the state, describing it as corrupt and aimed at stifling the party.

column7: CCES: Concerned Citizens of Edo State
column17: Indigenes of Edo State under an umbrella group called Concerned Citizens of Edo State protest at the National Assembly Complex against the Edo State Commissioner of Police, alleging 'incompetence.'

Unidentified gunmen attack Mgbuosimiri during the early morning hours of 09/10, killing ten. The attacks is believed to be related to a similar attack on the town on 05/10. The Nation reports 13 dead.

Unidentified gunmen open fire on a group of Port Harcourt market traders during the early morning hours. Ten reported dead. The reason for the attack is not known. This Day reports ""about 15 [dead].""

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.
Students of Auchi Polytechnic staged a protest against the management for non-conduct of students' union election in the institution.
Government officials attack and kill a civilian for refusing to pay taxes. The officials came to the victim's home and attempted to repossess the victim's belongings before the attack.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack at Yamteke village in Gwoza Local Government Area of Borno, kill 15. At least one soldier reported dead.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Movement of vehicles and commercial activities was paralysed in Ado-Ekiti as commercial drivers under the auspices of the National Union of Road Transport Workers (NURTW), staged a violent protest over alleged detention of their member by Governor Ayodele Fayose. The rioters threw stones at police. One death reported. The protest began the previous day.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three Boko Haram suicide bombers die in a failed attack on Dolori Hospital. No other causalities.

A member of the People's Democratic Party (PDP) from Ogwashi-Uku community, Mr. Emeka Chimokwu, who was recently kidnapped, has been found dead. The deceased's decomposing body was discovered in a thick forest at Idumuje-Uno in Aniocha North Council Area of the state. The victim was kidnapped ""last week,"" source dated 19/10.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four Boko Haram suicide bombers are dead following a failed attempt on Umarri. At least one of the bombers targeted a mosque. No other injuries were reported. The source notes the bombers were teenage girls.
A women's group protest insecurity in the area, particularly in regard to herdsman attacks.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Five people (plus the bomber) were killed in a suicide bomb attack when Boko Haram raided Belbelu village, near Kayamla, in the Konduga area of Borno state, at about 10:00 am (0900 GMT). The bomber was accompanied by other gunmen when fired wildly upon their attack of the village.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.
Residents of Chika, Aleyita, Pyakasa and Ketti protest a high electricity tariff on the Airport Road Abuja.
Residents of Abak Local Government Area of Akwa Ibom State have embarked on a peaceful demonstration, calling on the Federal Government to come to their aid in fixing an area road.
Residents of Oshodi-Isolo LGA protest high electricity bills.

column6: Police Forces of Nigeria (2015-) National Drug Law Enforcement Agency
column17: Three members of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) are shot and killed by unidentified gunmen in Okene.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: One person was reportedly shot in Ado Ekiti as commercial drivers under the platform of National Union of Road Transport Workers (NURTW) staged a violent protest over alleged detention of a member of the union. It took over 100 policemen to bring the situation under control. It is not clear if the deceased was a protester, police or bystander.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram raids a military location at Marte, killing one soldier and injuring nine others. The attackers carried away weapons.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces rescued a 6 year-old boy from Boko Haram captivity in Bama Local Government Area of Borno on 13/10. The troops also killed three Boko Haram insurgents in gun duel at various insurgents' enclaves in the area.

Four Britons are kidnapped by unidentified militants at Enukoroma community. The victims were said to have been kidnapped in the community to ""protest the heavy presence of soldiers drafted from 222 Battalion for the Operation Crocodile Smiles II.""

An unknown group attacked some villages in Barikin Ladi early on 14/10 and ""killed a lot of people."" (coded as 3) The violence is likely linked to Fulani violence, though it is not known when group was the aggressor.

On 14 October 2017, no fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.
On 14 October 2017, six dead and five injured in an attack on Taagbe village by unidentified gunmen. The attack is likely related to a series of tit-for-tat attacks between Fulanis and Irigwes.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces killed Boko Haram 3 insurgents in an ambush in Lingir village on or before 14/10 where they recovered 5 AK-47 rifles, 5 magazines and 11 rounds of 7.62mm (special) ammunition.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces ""recently"" (source dated 14/10) killed 2 fleeing Boko Haram militants in an ambush at Futchinam village in Geidam Local Government Area of Yobe.

Unidentified clan militia attacks Fulani civilians in Kajuru LGA. The date of the attack not known - likely during the month of October, though the attack could have occurred in September. Causalities likely.

Six Fulanis are attacked and killed by Irigwe militia at Buji. The attack led to a retaliatory strike against an IDP camp in Nkiedonwhro village the following day. The attack is believed to be based on grazing rights.

Unidentified clan militia attacks Fulani civilians in Mambilla Plateau. The date of the attack not known - likely during the month of October, though the attack could have occurred in September. Causalities likely.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.

Economic and commercial activities were Monday (16/10) grounded in Kajola and Araromi Communities in Akure South Local Government Area of Ondo State as residents of the two communities protested against the over eight months power outage.
Suspected communal militia attacks a village in Riyom LGA, and are repelled by an armed group in the village. Causality details are not known.

An attack at Rotsu village of Irigwe Chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State, has left one person dead and about 30 houses razed. The attack is believed to be related to a series of back-and-forth attacks between Fulanis and indigenes of the area.
Pensioners block roads in Benin City over a non-payment issue with their stipends.

Six residents of Danare community in Boki local government area were shot by gendarmes from Bodam community during an invasion on the Nigerian territory by Cameroonians. Additionally, 1,000 farmlands were destroyed. The attack is believed to be related to an international border dispute. The victims received treatment at an area hospital.

Economic and commercial activities were Monday (16/10) grounded in Kajola and Araromi Communities in Akure South Local Government Area of Ondo State as residents of the two communities protested against the over eight months power outage.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State on 16/10. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.

""Pandemonium"" in various parts of Ondo state after a forced student immunisation rumour spread. In some instances the parents of students forcibly entered classrooms to take their children, breaking security gates surrounding the school.
Non-violent activity: Gunmen attacked a APC governorship aspirant in Erio-Ekiti. The attackers wore police uniforms, though it is not known if they were legitimate officers. No reported injuries.
Library workers protest to demand action to enable the completion of its head office. On the same day, the 'Charly Boy' group protest in Abuja against alleged government graft.

""Pandemonium"" in various parts of Ondo state after a forced student immunisation rumour spread. In some instances the parents of students forcibly entered classrooms to take their children, breaking security gates surrounding the school.

Hundreds of Egbokodo Itsekiri indigenes in Warri South Local Government Area of Delta State took to the streets in protest of the continued closure of the United Nations Development Programme, UNDP- funded multi-million naira skills acquisition centre for over two years.

""Pandemonium"" in various parts of Ondo state after a forced student immunisation rumour spread. In some instances the parents of students forcibly entered classrooms to take their children, breaking security gates surrounding the school.

No fewer than 29 people were killed during a Fulani attack in Nkiedonwhro village of Irigwe chiefdom in Bassa Local Government Area of Plateau State. A secondary source claims 48 were dead over several days, between 08/10-17/10.

""Pandemonium"" in various parts of Ondo state after a forced student immunisation rumour spread. In some instances the parents of students forcibly entered classrooms to take their children, breaking security gates surrounding the school.
University of Nigeria Teaching Hospital marched round the hospital lamenting the decay in the facility.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least three soldiers were killed when Boko Haram fighters ambushed a military convoy in Damboa on 18/10. The Nigerian Tribune reports seven soldiers died.
Reports of shots fired during a protest over the non approval of a $350 million loan requested by the state government. It is not clear if the gunfire came from the protesting group or another actor.
Revenue officials attacked and killed a tanker driver over non-payment of fees along the Lokoja-Abuja road.
Truck drivers block roads following the killing of a colleague by revenue officials.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks a group of soldiers in Marte LGA, killing 11.

A police corporal shot and killed a teen-aged person in Kpansia. Demonstrators protested against police brutality following day. One of the protesters allegedly 'manhandled' a police officer on the scene.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 19 October 2017, air forces carry out a strike on Durwawa area (Konduga LGA, Borno). Military intelligence believe the wife of Abubakar Shekau, Mallama Fitdasi, had been killed in air strikes. Other structural damage reported.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces kill three Boko Haram attackers following an ambush at Missini. The soldiers were patrolling the Dikwa - Ngala road at the time.
Thousands protest in Benin City to call for economic reforms.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces laid ambush to a Boko Haram location at Muzine and killed 61.

A police corporal shot and killed a teen-aged person in Kpansia. Demonstrators protested against police brutality following day. One of the protesters allegedly 'manhandled' a police officer on the scene.
A motorist is shot and killed by police forces along the Enugu-Onitsha highway on 20/10. The action lead to a violent protest of local residents.
A motorist is shot and killed by police forces along the Enugu-Onitsha highway on 20/10. The action lead to a violent protest of local residents.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military air forces targeted nine Boko Haram camps around Gudumbali on 21/10. 350 reported dead. It had been learned the sect had been gathering in the area to launch attack on the surrounding towns.
One killed and shops burnt as Muslim and Christian youth clash at Dan Anacha in Taraba following a confrontation over blasphemy.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Ten are injured in a suspected Boko Haram suicide attack at a Maiduguri IDP camp. It is not known if the bomber was killed in the attack.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Twin explosions in Maiduguri, Borno State capital on Sunday night killed 16 people (14 in Muna Garage, 2 in Muna Dalti), including a wedding team and the suicide bombers. The explosions occurred at Muna Garage and Muna Dalti, suburbs of Maiduguri. Boko Haram are suspected as perpetrators. Other reports indicate a third explosion occurred at an area IDP camp, injuring 10 - it is not known if the bomber was lethally injured in this instance.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Twin explosions in Maiduguri, Borno State capital on Sunday night killed 16 people (14 in Muna Garage, 2 in Muna Dalti), including a wedding team and the suicide bombers. The explosions occurred at Muna Garage and Muna Dalti, suburbs of Maiduguri. Boko Haram are suspected as perpetrators. Other reports indicate a third explosion occurred at an area IDP camp, injuring 10 - it is not known if the bomber was lethally injured in this instance.

Two persons were said to have been shot dead after some soldiers clashed with some riotous youths in Sopp village, in Riyom Local Government Area of Plateau State. It was gathered that the youths were protesting against alleged poisoning of a 32-year-old during an air raid by members of the military Special Task Force. It is not known if the alleged poisoning was accidental.
A Fulani herdsman went missing 'last week'. The victims remains were discovered on 24/10 in Riyom local government of Plateau State.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigerian air forces launch a number of air strikes against Boko Haram location around Borno State. Only Arra and Boboshe are listed among the locations. Regarded as a ""major success,"" stating, ""[the strikes] destroyed the targeted structures and caused fire around the structures where they were hiding, sending a few survivors scampering for safety. [The helicopters] also strafed the area with rockets, subsequently taking out some of the fleeing Boko Haram survivors."" Exact causality figures not known. Recorded as 10 at each location instance.

Disabled persons hold protests at ExxonMobil facilities at Ibeno and Eket. The protesters blocked entrances and forcibility entered the buildings on 25/10 and 26/10. The protesters demanded social welfare from the company.
Residents of Oka in Ondo West Local Government Area of Ondo State protested what they called ""incessant activities of land grabbers in the town.""

column17: Accompanied by the ""Civilian JTF"", military forces raid Boko Haram locations at Mogole, Ngaiwa, Tongule, and Warsele villages in Ngala LGA, killing 11 insurgents. Remaining fatalities recorded in other events.

Unidentified gunmen attack Ihieorji village in Aba South. Unconfirmed reports from the area gave the death toll to ten with several persons injured. It was learnt that about four persons died on the spot, while two others died at the hospital while they were being given medical attention.

A group of 25 minor political parties protest at the electoral commission in Enugu over the exclusion of their candidates.
After a Fulani herdsman went missing last week an attack was launched by unknown attackers against unidentified victims in Riyom LGA leaving two dead.

One person was feared dead, scores injured, and about 40 houses set ablaze during a communal clash that ensued on Tuesday in Mbayion, Gboko Local Government Area of Benue State. The clash is believed to be liked to a land tussle between the Mbayion and the Mbatiav people.

Disabled persons hold protests at ExxonMobil facilities at Ibeno and Eket. The protesters blocked entrances and forcibility entered the buildings on 25/10 and 26/10. The protesters demanded social welfare from the company.
Confrontations between unidentified ""farmers"" and ""herdsmen"" (likely Fulani) in Yola South LGA causes two deaths on 25/10 and four deaths on 27/10.

column17: Movement of forces: Intelligence reports indicate Boko Haram has begun to move into Adamawa State in great numbers, particularly the Madagali area. The mass movement has likely been brought on by continued military offensives in Borno. Source dated 27/10.
On 25 October 2017, IS West Africa militants attacked Nigerian army soldiers in Sasawa, killing 8, and injuring a number of others, and seizing vehicles, weapons, and ammunitions.
Members of the Islamic Movement (Shia) protest in Abuja over the detention of their leader, Sheikh Zakzaky.
A group of market traders protest 'marginalization' by the state government in Sapele.
A group of five unidentified gunmen abduct a monarch from his home in Ikot Nya.

column17: Military forces kill three Boko Haram and wound others at Lumda in the early morning hours of 26/10. The forces also recovered weapons.

Disabled persons hold protests at ExxonMobil facilities at Ibeno and Eket. The protesters blocked entrances and forcibility entered the buildings on 25/10 and 26/10. The protesters demanded social welfare from the company.
Students protest at the headquarters of Port Harcourt Electricity Distribution Company as well as the office of the governor after a school mate was electrocuted.

column7: KYMCL: Kogi Youth Movement for Credible Leadership
column17: Some members of Kogi Youth Movement for Credible Leadership (KYMCL) on 27/10 staged a protest against the alleged donation of 1,260 bags of rice by some Senators to civil servants in Kogi. The protest was carried out along the Abuja-Lokoja highway causing gridlock as the youths trooped into the expressway for about an hour to express their displeasure over the donation.
Confrontations between unidentified ""farmers"" and ""herdsmen"" (likely Fulani) in Yola South LGA causes two deaths on 25/10 and four deaths on 27/10.

column17: On 27/10 military forces carried out Boko Haram clearance operations at Gawa, Bone, Kajeri I, Kajeri II, Kube, Dubula, Boboshe I and Boboshe II villages in Borno State. No reported violence.

column17: Military forces kill three members of Boko Haram at Dure. The force also engaged Boko Haram at Jango, Nduma, Gobara, Bala Ibrahim, Fulani Rogo, Takwala villages.

column17: The Nigerian Army repelled an attempted attack on Goniri village in Yobe on 28/10. Casualties not known.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces kill three members of Boko Haram at Dure. The force also engaged Boko Haram at Jango, Nduma, Gobara, Bala Ibrahim, Fulani Rogo, Takwala villages.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers blew themselves up in what appears to be a failed mission at Magar village in Madagali Local Government Area of Adamawa state. Reports from witnesses in the area indicated that the two bombers who strapped improvised explosive devices on their bodies sneaked into the village in the early hours of 28/10 but the explosives detonated before they could reach their targets. A woman was however injured in the blast.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram suicide bombers strike in the Muna Garage area. The Borno State Emergency Management Agency on Monday, confirmed that 17 people lost their lives and 18 others wounded.
APC youth protest at their party's headquarters over alleged interparty corruption and called for the removal of a leader.
A vigilante group attack and kills three suspected motorcycle thieves.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four soldiers reportedly died on Monday, while six others sustained injuries when troops of 152 Battalion, 21 Brigade of the Nigerian Army engaged Boko Haram at Banki in Bama LGA. It was reported the Boko Haram also suffered a ""heavy loss"". A second article from the same source claims 20 Boko Haram dead.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces kill two members of Boko Haram as the fled on horseback at Gambo Yukku forest in Gubio LGA.
Hundreds of artisans on 31/10 stormed the Lagos State House of Assembly to protest demolition of their buildings in the state by the state government.

Fulanis attack several Plateau villages in ""in the last two weeks"" (source dated 09/11), including Wereh, Foron and Rim in Barkin Ladi Local Government Area as well as Miango, Jebu, Taegbe and Ncha in Bassa Local Government Area. Causalities not known.

More than 200 former militants from the Niger Delta protested the non payment of their allowances in front of the National Assembly in Abuja.
Members of the Islamic Movement (Shia) protest in Kano over the detention of their leader, Sheikh Zakzaky.

Students of Akwa Ibom state origin studying in tertiary institutions embarked on a peaceful protest against the state governor, Udom Emmanuel, for allegedly ""refusing to show interest in their welfare.""
Five are dead following a boundary dispute in Itim-Amagu in Ikwo LGA and Adadama in Abi LGA.
Protests in Makurdi in support of a new anti-grazing law aimed at stemming Fulani attacks in the state.

Street sweepers employed under the State Employment and Expenditure for Results (SEEFOR) projects in Edo State protested their unpaid seven-month arrears in Benin.

A vigilante group attacks and kills a suspected kidnapper in Ibadan.

Explosions injure three (possibly kill; unknown) during Enugu State council elections. The first occurred around 8:20am at Coal Camp in Enugu North Council area of Enugu State just before voting began. Three injured. The second was reported at Amechi, Awkunanaw voting centre

The attack caused a large portion of the residents to flee for safety.

Fulani, fleeing from Benue State following the implementation of an anti-grazing law, attack Jangaru area of Awe, leaving scores dead and many hospitalised.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces clear Talala, Ajigin, Mangzum, Abagajiri, Kafa, Dusula, Buk, Malumti and Abulam (among unnamed others) of Boko Haram during unknown dates during the week of 06/11 - 13/11. Three soldiers killed during the operations.
Motorcyclists protest police extortion in Akure.
Taxi drivers light bonfires in protest a case of police brutality against a colleague. Police made arrests.
Police allegedly attack a taxi driver without provocation. The attack led to a protest.

There is tension at Iyana-Iba, around the main gate to the Lagos State University, as hundreds of commercial motorcycle riders have barricaded the entire road leading from Lagos to Badagry area of the state. The motorcycle riders were protesting the seizure of the motorcycles by the state task force.
Ikorodu area residents protest a prolonged power outage in Ikeja.
Members of the """"Young Pharmacists Group"""" protest in Kano over employment discrimination.
Protest in Kaduna following the termination of a number of state employed teachers.
Members of the NLC violently protest a teacher layoff proposal.
Police disperse a Shiite (Islamic Movement) protest in Kano. The protesters were calling for the release of their incarcerated leader. No violence reported.

Members of Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) took to major streets of Onitsha and its environs calling for boycott of an upcoming Anambra State governorship election. The group marched along major roads including Awka road, Old Market road, New Market road to Main Market, Oguta road and Upper Iweka to Owerri road vowing that there would be no election in the state or 'Biafra land' unless a referendum was held for the exit of Igbo people from Nigeria.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces clear Shyadawe-Angwan-Fulani, Shyadawe-Angwan-Bula-Musa and Shyadawe in the Sambisa Forces area on 10/11. The troops captured two gun trucks, three motorcycles, many bicycles and a laptop containing valuable information. They also located a vandalised and unserviceable tank in one of the camps. No violence reported.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces ambushed a group of Boko Haram in Bama LGA 'killing many.' Elsewhere in the LGA military forces cleared a Boko Haram camp and rescued a young prisoner.
Following a spate of violence protesters call on Fulanis to leave the area.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least three Nigerian soldiers and a militiaman were killed in a Boko Haram ambush in Gwoza on 10/11.

A protest march by members of the Islamic Movement in Nigeria (IMN) demanding the release of their leader, Ibrahim Zakzaky becomes violent following a clash with police. The report was late-breaking and the injury figures are not known.
The governor of Rivers State survives an assassination attempt allegedly perpetrated by members of the Special Anti Robbery Squad.

Several are injured in a clash between the security detail of Rivers State Governor Nyesom Wike and those of Minister of Transportation Chibuile Amaechi, PDP and APC, respectively, in Port Harcourt. Injuries reported. The clash may have been related to an assassination attempt against Wike.

Three persons were 'at the weekend' injured in Twon Brass, Brass Local Government Area of Bayelsa State following a bloody clash between supporters of the All Progressives Congress (APC) and Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in the area. Persons involved in the violence were said to be loyalists of the APC House of Assembly member, Israel Sunny-Igoli and the newly- appointed Caretaker Committee Chairman of Brass, Victor Isaiah.
Osi and Etan militias clash over two days over 'a long-held dispute.' Two dead, four injured.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least two persons were killed and many others feared injured as gunmen believed to be Boko Haram insurgents attacked Maikadiri village in Askira-Uba Local Government Area. The attack came at night. Some violence spilled into the following day.
Osi and Etan militias clash over two days over 'a long-held dispute.' Two dead, four injured.
Members of Islamic Movement and police clash during a protest. Ten arrests reported.
After a man is killed in a suspected land dispute, youths of Aiyegbaju Ekiti protest violently. Police made 20 arrests.
A soldier was reported beating civilians in the Chibok area. His captain and three other soldiers attempt to stop the attack, the perpetrator shot the squad, then himself.

A soldier was reported beating civilians in the Chibok area. When his captain and three other soldiers attempt to stop the attack the perpetrator shot the squad, then himself. The status of the civilian is not known.
After a man is killed in a suspected land dispute, youths of Aiyegbaju Ekiti protest violently. Police made 20 arrests.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least two persons were killed and many others feared injured as gunmen believed to be Boko Haram insurgents attacked Maikadiri village in Askira-Uba Local Government Area. The attack came at night. Some violence spilled into the following day.

Two people were killed at Wereng village of Riyom Local Government Area by suspected Fulanis. The victims were said to have been ambushed near Wereng Station and were found dead the following morning.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four members of Boko Haram attacked Muktum village of Gujba LGA, targeting and killing one of the attacker's father.
Hundreds of villagers blocked the Kaduna-Abuja highway in Chikun LGA, protesting the killing of the Commander of Civilian JTF Haruna Halilu in their community by suspected kidnappers.

column7: NUPOS: National Union of Pensioners in Oyo State; Teachers (Nigeria)
column17: On 13 November 2017, a teacher's union protests unpaid salaries. [size=no report].
On 13 November 2017, hospital staff protests over salaries. [size=no report].

Students, protesting alleged mismanagement at their school, clash with police. Several injuries reported. The unrest is apparently unrelated to a teacher protest elsewhere in the city. Police may have inadvertently shot a bystander, status unknown.

Gunmen suspected to be 'ex-militants' have attacked a police patrol team by Ovia River bridge along Benin-Iguobazuwa road in Ovia South West Local Government Area of Edo State. Police sources said the attack, which happened on Monday left one policeman dead and three others injured while the patrol vehicle they were using was burnt.
Workers of the Nigerian Institute of Mining and Geo-sciences (NIMG), Jos on 15/11 staged a peaceful protest against alleged mismanagement of the outfit by its Chief Executive Officer.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Four suicide bombers attack the Muna area, killing twelve civilians (this figure was later raised to 18, plus 29 injured), including themselves.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 15 November 2017, Boko Haram clashed with soldiers, hunters and a local armed group after an attempted attack on Sabon Gari and Kafin Hausa (Madagali, Adamawa). The BH attackers killed many livestock, and looted and burnt many houses. No reported deaths or injuries.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 15 November 2017, Boko Haram clashed with soldiers, hunters and a local armed group after an attempted attack on Sabon Gari and Kafin Hausa (Madagali, Adamawa). The BH attackers killed many livestock, and looted and burnt many houses. No reported deaths or injuries.

Bachama farmers attack Fulani civilians in Adamawa State. This was the first of two such attacks. The second took place in Numan later in the month. The date and location of the first attack is not known. Causalities likely.
Ijaw and Urhobo residents of Ogbe-Ijoh, Isaba and Aladja clash on 15/11. A total of three dead, twenty injured. The clash is believed to be related to land use.
Ijaw and Urhobo residents of Ogbe-Ijoh, Isaba and Aladja clash on 15/11. A total of three dead, twenty injured. The clash is believed to be related to land use.
Ijaw and Urhobo residents of Ogbe-Ijoh, Isaba and Aladja clash on 15/11. A total of three dead, twenty injured. The clash is believed to be related to land use.
Hundreds of residents of Otodo-Gbame community gathered at the Lagos State Governor's Office, Alausa, to protest against their forced eviction from their riverine community.
Non-academic staff of the University of Obafemi Awolowo University protest payments ""in November.""
Pensioners protest over unpaid arrears.
Police broke up a sit-in protest of slum dwellers. The protesters were demonstrating against a forced eviction of their waterfront homes.
Students of Obafemi Awolowo University protested in Oshogbo over ""exploitation"" by the school's management.
Protests following a military-led criminal raid on Peremabiri. The protesters perceived the military action as an invasion.

column7: NUP: Nigeria Union of Pensioners; Teachers (Nigeria)
column17: 3,000 retired primary school teachers, under the umbrella of the National Union of Pensioners (NUP) in Oyo State protested non-payment of their 17-56 months pension arrears.
""Thugs"" attack PDP members and supporters at Kwall Stadium, venue of an upcoming election. Injuries reported.
A cameraman with the Anambra Broadcasting Service (ABS), Mr Ikechukwu Onubogu, has been found dead four days after he was declared missing. The date of death and perpetrators not known.

Villagers of Sabuwar Gayan in Chikun Local Government of Area of Kaduna State blocked the Kaduna-Abuja highway, protesting the killing of the Commander of Civilian JTF Haruna Halilu in their community by suspected kidnappers. The situation caused heavy gridlock as both lanes of the road were blocked for two hours.
Farmers and suspected Fulanis clash in Bakoshi, Suru LGA. It is believed the farmers instigated the clash. Area police made several arrests. At least one death.

Unidentified gunmen attacked a group of soldiers guarding a storage facility operated by Royal Dutch Shell and British Petroleum in Port-Harcourt. One soldier dead. The reason for the attack is not known.
A vigilante mob attacks and lynches two over alleged motorcycle theft.

column7: Police Forces of Nigeria (2015-); Vigilante Group (Nigeria)
column17: Two suspected members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) were attacked by a ""mob"" and later arrested by the police in Anambra East after it was suspected they planned to disrupt an election. It is believed the pair were first attacked by a 'mob.'

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram suicide bombers attack Alakaramtii village of Jere LGA in two waves. The bombers were teen-aged females. The first came in the ""wee"" hours of the day, the second at 0600hrs. The one of the bombers in the second pair took off her vest and placed in next to a house before fleeing. At least four dead, including the three bombers.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Three Boko Haram suicide bombers (two detonated) attack Maiduguri on 18/11, killing two (plus two bombers). Xinhua claims five dead and four wounded.
Unidentified assassins kill three at the compound of the Commissioner of Local Government and Chieftaincy Affairs.

Many members of the opposition Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Kwara state protested in Ilorin, state capital to protest allegations of electoral frauds perpetrated by the ruling All Progressive Congress(APC) in the concluded local governments elections conducted at the weekend. Police made arrests.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate the village head of Tarangol community.
Pensioners protest over unpaid arrears in Owerri.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram insurgents have beheaded six farmers at Dimge plantation, in Mafa Local Government Area of Borno State. Seven others were abducted.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Lawati village in Jere, kills six.
Students from varying schools throughout Osun State protest in Oshogbo against a tuition hike. The protesters blocked roads and clashed with police.
Residents of Uhumnwonde Local Government Area protest at the Edo State House assembly over the suspension of their elected representative.
An APC chieftain is found dead with injuries to the head. Perpetrators not known.

At least 30 people were killed when Bachama farmers attacked Fulani civilians in Kikan, Kodomun, Shafaran and Ketowal villages of Numan LGA. Fatalities vary; some witness claim 47, others 60. According to witnesses, this was the second attack by Bachama farmers this month against Fulanis in Adamawa. The date and the second location are not known. Fatalities divided between two events.

According to witnesses, this was the second attack by Bachama farmers this month against Fulanis in Adamawa. The date and the second location are not known. Fatalities divided between two events.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 50 people were killed when a suicide bomber blew himself up in a mosque in Adamawa State. The attack was blamed on Boko Haram. The blast happened during early morning prayers at the Madina mosque in the Unguwar Shuwa area of Mubi.
Students demonstrate in support of an anti-cultism law.

column7: NAAPE: National Association of Aircraft Pilots and Engineers
column17: NAAPE pilots protest, shut down Dana Air operations over casualization. The protesters barricaded the airline's ticket offices in one of the airport's terminals.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Air forces destroy a Boko Haram ammunitions base 23km south of Konduga. The strikes took place over two days, though the specific dates are not revealed by the source. An military announcement of the operation was made on 22/11. No reported causalities.
Pensioners protest in Ejigbo over the non-payment of salaries.
Ikolo and Aku communities clash in Igbo-Etiti over rights to land usage. The clash lasted for several hours, causing the destruction of several building. No reported loss of life.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Local hunters pursued and killed a Boko Haram cattle thief in Gur, Borno State. (Boko Haram often steal livestock to finance their operation.)

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram kills seven farm workers at Sabon Gari in Gombi LGA.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigerian air forces strike a ""large gathering"" of Boko Haram at Bogumari on 24/11. Causalities reported, number not known.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Magumeri during the evening hours. Military forces repulsed the attack. Three soldiers dead, six injured; one civilian dead, three injured.
An oil mogul escapes an assassination attempt by unruly mob in Abonnema. The rioters attacked his car with stones. No reported injury.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces clear Abusuriwa, Newchina, Bonzon, Usmanari, Goyayeri, Shitimari, Gashimari and Awaram villages in Bama Local Government Area of Boko Haram elements. Eight dead, 30 rescued.

column17: Military forces clear Abusuriwa, Newchina, Bonzon, Usmanari, Goyayeri, Shitimari, Gashimari and Awaram villages in Bama Local Government Area of Boko Haram elements. Eight dead, 30 rescued.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces engage Boko Haram at Kumshe and Dar el Jamal villages, six Boko Haram dead.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces engage Boko Haram at Kumshe and Dar el Jamal villages, six Boko Haram dead.
Two groups of youths violently protest for and against the postponement of an upcoming election. The unrest lasted two days. Several buildings destroyed. One death reported on the first day.
A journalist is shot and killed by unknown assailants ""at the weekend"" while on a hunting expedition in Ekiti East LGA.
Two groups of youths violently protest for and against the postponement of an upcoming election. The unrest lasted two days. Several buildings destroyed. One death reported on the first day.

column7: NYSC: National Youth Service Corps; Teachers (Nigeria)
column17: 3,000 National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) members deployed to public secondary schools in Nasarawa state on Monday in Lafia protested over alleged non payment of their state allowances.
Nigerian Union of Teachers (NUT) protest to call for greater local authority in schools.

Scores of people blocked the Zuba-Kaduna highway in Abuja to protest what they said was the excessive granting of land to the Army in the Nigerian capital. The protesters carried placards and put a halt to movement of traffic.
Striking staff of tertiary institutions owned by Oyo State Government protest payment of salary arrears. No reported unrest. A second protest of non-academic staff took place elsewhere in the city.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigerian air forces strike a ""large gathering"" of Boko Haram at Gobars (near Gwoza) on 28/11. Causalities reported, number not known.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces kill four Boko Haram fighters, capture a commander (""Ameer"" of Chawa, Amman Judee) and rescue 212 hostages during an operation in Sambisa.

Members of the Nigerian Union of Teachers (NUT) in Kebbi State protested against transfer of primary school teachers salary to Local Government authorities. The protesters took their grievances to the state's House of Assembly demanding a rejection of the Bill sent to the state from the National Assembly.
Non-academic staff of the University of Ibadan block the entrance of the school in protest over non-payment of allowances.
Five persons have been allegedly killed by youths in Eyobisung village in Udung Uko local government areas of Akwa Ibom State. The youths accused the victims of witchcraft.
Four are dead after unidentified assailants entered Ogwashi-Uku and set four residents alight with petrol.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two people were killed when Boko Haram fighters attacked Wanu village, some three kilometres (just under two miles) from the town of Gulak, at about 7:30 pm (1830 GMT) on Wednesday. The Sun reports 5 dead.
Employees of the Nigerian Tourism Development Corporation protest in Abuja over ""unfriendly work environment in the Agency.""
Nigerian Union of Teachers, NUT, Taraba State chapter, stormed the state House of Assembly, protesting the proposed local government autonomy.
A police officer shot a trader while attempting to confiscate illegal goods.
Three children were killed and a teacher injured when a man armed with a machete stormed a primary school. Perpetrators not known, though the source references Boko Haram activity in the area.
A coalition of Civil society groups protest at the Libyan embassy in Abuja. The protest was related to reports of slave trading in Libya.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram killed a soldier and wounded three others in a raid on a military post in Gajibo village near Dikwa. Military forces announced the following week that they had killed three Boko Haram.
Four minors were injured following an attack by unidentified actors.
Unidentified gunman ambushed a group of travellers at Vwak town, Riyom.

Residents from Ita Sanni, Gbaga, Ogijo, Odogunyan, Agbede, 1st Gate, Okegbegun and Ikorodu in Lagos and Ogun states protested poor condition of Ikorodu/Sagamu road which they claimed has recorded many untimely deaths.

A prominent cattle dealer and three of his aides are assassinated for unknown reason at Yenagoa.

column17: 25 people were killed and 53 wounded in a dual suicide bomb attack at a busy morning market in Biu on 02/12. No group has claimed responsibility, though Boko Haram is believed responsible.

Protesters, alleging neglect and refusal to live up to their social responsibility, angry youths and residents of Tanbiri II community, Biseni, in Yenagoa Local Government Area of Bayelsa State, disrupted oil production at Adibawa oil field operated by Shell Petroleum Development Company (SPDC), and shut down two oil wells.
A police officer shot and killed an APC protester during a rally in Ajaokuta. A second report claims the police officer many have been inebriated while reporting three dead.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces neutralize three Boko Haram members at Sabsabwa.
Several unions representing Obafemi Awolowo University began a labour strike. Several members of the unions protested following the announcement.
Several non-academic staff unions protest at the University of Lagos over allowances.
A civilian is assassinated by unidentified gunmen in Benin.

In apparent retaliation from violence against them in mid-November, Fulani militia attacks Lawaru, Dong and Kiken villages in Demsa and Numan Local Government areas killing ""many"" and burning structures.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces neutralize four Boko Haram members at Miyanti-Darel Jamel.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military authorities say Nigerian soldiers have arrested more than 400 people associated with the Boko Haram extremist group hiding on the islands of Lake Chad, including fighters, wives and children. The operation lasted over a course of two weeks (source dated 16/12). Among those arrested were 167 Boko Haram fighters, 67 women and 173 children. Another 57 insurgents were arrested during a separate operation in ""another part"" of the region. The operation included air and ground offensives. The military said many Boko Haram insurgents were killed, but it did not give details.

In apparent retaliation from violence against them in mid-November, Fulani militia attacks Lawaru, Dong and Kiken villages in Demsa and Numan Local Government areas killing ""many"" and burning structures.

Residents of Ijegun-Imore community in Satellite Town, Lagos State protested four months of power outage in the area by Eko Electricity Distribution Company (EKDC).Hundreds of placard-carrying protesters from David West New Site Estate blocked their major road, preventing motorists from passing through the area.
One civilian is assassinated by suspected hired assassins in Ijaye. The motive is believed to be political, though details are not known.

#OurMumuDonDo protesters led by 'Charly Boy' gather at Ministry of Foreign Affairs to demand well coordinated government action to ameliorate the plight of Nigerians allegedly sold as slaves in Libya.
A group of visually impaired persons staged a protest in Owerri accusing the state government of not addressing their needs.

In apparent retaliation from violence against them in mid-November, Fulani militia attacks Lawaru, Dong and Kiken villages in Demsa and Numan Local Government areas killing ""many"" and burning structures.
No fewer than 11 persons were ambushed and killed by suspected herdsmen in Rim town.
A group protests alleged unjust arrest in Amagu.
Electricity consumers in Calabar South axis of Cross River State protest six weeks of power outage in the area.

The protesters blocked traffic and allegedly destroyed vehicles belonging to the officials of the ENTRACO.
Unknown assassins killed two children in Obiokpok village in Nsit Ibom Local Government Area of Akwa Ibom State for yet to be ascertained reason.
Members of the Indigenous Peoples of Biafra protest over the detention of their leader.

The military said many Boko Haram insurgents were killed, but it did not give details.
Electricity consumers in Odeagba and Arthur Eze Avenue areas in Awka took to the streets to protest power outage in the area for the past nine months.
Unidentified perpetrators abduct a PDP chieftain outside of Jos.
Protest at the Lagos State Assembly accusing the House Speaker of hurting the area tourism industry.
