20 April. Police forces in Nyanya rescued a suspected thief from a mob that almost lynched the suspect to death. [size=no report]

21 April. A police officer got engaged in an argument with a civilian and shot him dead in Ifo.
21 April. Residents of Nariya/Kaduna city protested the recent kidnappings in their area. The protest was staged at a the highway crossing the community. [size=no report]
21 April. Unidentified gunmen attacked Yar Santa Sherere village and killed 10 civilians. Five sustained injuries.
21 April. Residents of Nariya and Kanama communities protested the kidnappings in their area. The protest took place on the Nnamdi Azikwe Expressway in Abuja. [size=no report]
21 April. An unidentified armed group, suspected to be linked to political party, destroyed the property of an APC lawmaker in Ifo town.
21 April. Suspected Tiv Militias attacked Katsina Alla community and killed five civilians.

column6: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Security and Civil Defence Corps

25 April. Teachers protested the non-payment of their salaries in Ikere Ekiti. [size=500]

26 April. Unidentfied gunmen attacked Kargi and Kugu villages, killed two people, wounded two civilians and stole cows and grains. Fatalities split between both events.

26 April. Residents of Kegbara Dere demonstrated against the entering of Shell employees in their community to conduct repair works on oil infrastructure. Soldiers, that accompanied the workers, opened fire on the demonstrators and killed one.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 26 April. Boko Haram IS attacked a base of Nigerian Military Forces in Mararrabar Kimba and defeated the armed forces. BH seized weapons and escaped. Five soldiers killed and 30 are missing.

column17: 22 June. NAF, along with the JTF, discovered a Boko Haram camp in Dubula, destroyed it and killed one BH fighter.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 22 June. NAF and CJTF conducted clearance operations against Boko Haram in Kobe and Boboshe villages. During which, 26 kidnapped children and 13 women were rescued.
22 June. Tiv militias attacked Tsondi, razed down 32 houses and killed an undisclosed number of residents.
22 June. The distribution of gas stations in an Akure neighborhood sparked protests by residents fearing threats from too many gas stations concentrated on one area. [size=no report]
23 June. The Ikot Osute and Ikot Ukpong communities got engaged in a violent clash over a love relationship. Three people were killed in the battle.
24 June (or around). Protesters gathered at the state house in Awka to complain about land acquisition by local chief. [size=100]
24 June. APC members protested in Abuja over an alleged high jacking of President Buhari's administration by his chief of staff. [size=200]

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 24 June. Boko Haram IS launched an attack on Mafa but was repelled by NAF. Three BH fighters were killed.
25 June. Civil society groups in a protest urged the Lagos Governor to transform the city into an African Dubai. [size=no report]

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 25 June. Boko Haram invaded Ngamgam village (approx position, 50km east of Damasak) and killed 20 farmers.
25 June. Pensioners in Osogbo protested the non-payment of their arrears for 15 months. [size=hundreds]
25 June. Suspected Fulani militias attacked Koton-Karfi and Onzo communities. Seven residents were killed. Fatalities split between two events.
25 June. Suspected Fulani militias attacked Koton-Karfi and Onzo communities. Seven residents were killed. Fatalities split between two events.
25 June. Residents of oil producing communities protested the resumption of oil production in their area by Shell. The protest was staged in Port Harcourt. [size=no report]
25 June. Suspected Tiv militias attacked the Jukun community of Rafin Kada. Five people were killed and 32 houses burnt.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 25 June. Boko Haram invaded Kaula village and killed nine residents. Food and livestock were stolen.
25 June. Suspected Tiv militias blocked the Wukari-Jalingo road at Takum junction and killed 10 civilians.
25 June. Suspected Tiv militias attacked the Jukun community of Tor Musa. Five people were killed.

25 June. A group of eight hunters were lynched and killed by a mob in Borong. They were taken for bandits, as they were carrying in their traditional attire and carrying arms for a wedding ceremony. [size=no report]
26 June (or around). A combined team of NAF and Police conducted an operation against Zamfara Militias in Moriki. 29 militants, two soldiers and one police officer were killed.

On 26 June 2019, members of APC protested in Abuja to show their support for President Buhari's Chief of Staff. Protesters called on Buhari to ignore the demonstration staged on June 24 against the Chief of Staff. [size=no report]

column7: Labour Group (Nigeria); ASCSUN: Association of Senior Civil Servants of Nigeria
column17: On 26 June 2019, members of ASCSUN protested their employment conditions at the National Commission for Mass Literacy, Adult and Non-formal Education (NMEC) office in Abuja. [size=no report]
26 June. Protesting youth of Mbiaobong Anyaya in Uyo LGA threw stones at a team tasked to demolish illegal buildings in the area. [size=no report]
26 June. Protesters in Warri demanded the appointment of Delta state descents as new MD or Director of the Niger Delta Development Commission. [size=no report]
26 June. NAF conducted an operation against Zamfara Militias in Wanke and Kanoma. Militants were injured and stolen cattle was recovered.
26 June. NAF conducted an operation against Zamfara Militias in Dan Sadau. 15 militants, one soldier and a local militia member were killed.
26 June. NAF conducted an operation against Zamfara Militias in Wanke and Kanoma. Militants were injured and stolen cattle was recovered.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 26 June. Boko Haram attacked military positions in Goniri and was repelled by NAF. An undisclosed number of BH fighters were killed. Fatalities coded as 10.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 26 June. The Nigerian Airforce conducted an airstrike against Boko Haram IS and destroyed a camp in Kollaram (no coordinates available) in Northern Borno. Several BH fighters were killed. Fatalities coded 10.
27 June. IDPs in Maiduguri protested the alleged diversion of aid supplies and food by camp managers. [size=thousands]
27 June. Suspected Fulani militias attacked Seriki and injured the village head.
27 June. Unidentified gunmen attacked Wukari, set ablaze houses and stole property.
27 June. Five unidentified gunmen, in police uniforms, stormed a market in Minna. Youth disarmed them, detained the suspects, and handed them over to the police.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 28 June. Nigerian Airforce conducted airstrikes against Boko Haram IS in Gobara and Bakassi (Lake Chad area) killing an undisclosed number of BH fighters. Fatalities coded as 10 for each event.
28 June. Youth in Zaki-Biam and Otobi protested the proposed settling of pastoralists in their area of Rugu. [size=hundreds]
28 June. Youth in Zaki-Biam and Otobi protested the proposed settling of pastoralists in their area of Rugu. [size=hundreds]

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 28 June. The Nigerian Airforce conducted airstrikes against Boko Haram IS in Gobara (Gwoza LGA) and Bakassi killing an undisclosed number of BH fighters. Fatalities coded as 10 for each event.
28 June. Suspected Fulani Militias killed a farmer in Orin Ekiti.
28 June. Residents of Orin Ekiti protested the recent killings in their area. [size=no report]
On 29 June 2019, unidentified gunmen invaded Yar Kuka village in Kankara LGA and killed three residents. Geo location unknown, coded as Kankara.
On 29 June 2019, unidentified gunmen attacked Danhayi, Gidan Guge, Kaurawa, Jan Bago, Gidan Kwaki and Lambar Kantoma. No coordinates available, all the villages are located in Kankara LGA.
29 June. Unidentified gunmen invaded Katoji village and killed eight residents.
29 June. Unidentified gunmen attacked Pauwa.
29 June. Unidentified gunmen attacked Kadanyan.
29 June (or around). Protesters with a Beninoise background protested in Abuja and demanded the intervention of President Buhari in the Benin crisis. [size=dozens]
On 30 June 2019, supporters of the pastor that allegedly raped a church member gathered in Abuja to demonstrate their loyalty to the pastor. [size=no report]

column8: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: 30 June. Demonstrators in Maiduguri demonstrated against the recent killing of a rickshaw driver by CJTF and demanded a ban of the militia forces. The demonstrators barricaded roads. CJTF responded by burning barricades , assaults with batons, and detaining demonstrators. [size=2000]

30 June (or around). Residents of Kankara barricaded major roads in the area with the corpses of the killed villagers in the LGA. The demonstration was staged at the seat of the LGA chairman. [size=no report]

column6: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: 30 June. CJTF shot and killed a rickshaw driver at a checkpoint in Maiduguri.
30 June. NAF conducted airstrikes against Zamfara Militias in the Dumburum forest. 10 fleeing militants were killed.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 30 June (or around). NAF encountered Boko Haram near Gwoza, as they planned to ambush civilians. Two BH fighters were killed.
30 June. Agbaduma and Abogbe Communal Militias clashed in Okololo. 25 people were killed.
30 June. A suspected thief was detained by youth and later rescued by police forces in Makurdi. [size=no report]
01 July. Unidentified gunmen stormed a police station in Agudama-Ekpetiama and killed four officers. Four others were injured.
01 July. Youth in Umuoke Obowo burned down the police station after the killing of a resident by a police officer. [size=no report]
01 July. A resident of Umuike Obowo was shot by a police officer.
01 July. Tricycle operators in Umuahia protested the alleged multiple taxation and extortion by the government. [size=hundreds]
01 July. Residents of Jalingo protested the planned settlement of Fulani Pastoralists in the area. [size=no report]
01 July. A former leader of Kwande LGA and APC supporter was killed by unknown gunmen in Adikpo.
02 July. NAF encountered Zamfara Militias during a ground operation at Bawa. 10 militants were killed in the clash.

column7: NASU: Non-Academic Staff Union; Labour Group (Nigeria)
column17: 02 July. Staff of Lagos State Polytechnic and members of the NASU protested against the management of their institution. Police forces intervened and fired tear-gas. [size=no report]
02 July. Youth of Kula community protested the presence of Shell in their area and their poor CSR performance. [size=no report]
02 July. NAF conducted airstrikes against Zamfara Militias in Munhaye. 20 militias were killed.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 02 July. Boko Haram IS attacked a military position in Gajigana.
02 July. Youth from Bakassi protested in Calabar and urged the Government to revise the decision of handing over oil wells from Cross River State to Akwa Ibom state. [size=no report]
03 July. Fulani militias entered Obokofia village after a dispute over grazing land and shot in the air. Crops were destroyed.
03 July. Residents of Effurun protested unstable power supply in their community by the Benin Electricity Distribution Company. [size=no report]

column7: NASU: Non-Academic Staff Union; Labour Group (Nigeria); SSANU: Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities
column17: 03 July. SSANU and NASU unions protested at the University of Ibadan against the non-implementation of a court ruling. [size=no report]
03 July. Unidentified gunmen attacked Ungwan Rabo (coordinates are approximate based on proximity to Dutsin Dadi) and killed nine residents.
03 July. Unidentified gunmen attacked Ungwan Maganda and killed six residents.
03 July. Unidentified gunmen attacked Ungwan Dadi and killed two residents.
03 July. Women groups protested against a Senator who allegedly slapped a woman. Police forces intervened and dispersed the protest. [size=50]
03 July. Pensioners in Osogbo protested the non-payment of their retirement benefits. [size=no report]
03 July. Workers of Ascot Limited protested at their HQ in Choba demanding their salaries for the past 14 years. [size=no report]
04 July (or around). Tanker drivers blocked the Minna-Suleja highway to protest extortion by security personal at checkpoints [size=no report]
04 July. Students of LASPOTECH protested the shutdown of their institution due to the conflict between the management and the staff. [size=hundreds]
05 July. Staff of the Warri Refining and Petrochemical Company protested at the companies HQ in Warri and demanded the conversion of their contracts into permanent employment. [size=500]
05 July. Police used teargas to prevent market women from entering Oye market in Ukpo.
05 July. Yansakai and Zamfara militias exchanged captives as part of an ongoing peace and reconciliation process in Zamfara state. Yansakai released 25 Fulani and Zamfara Militias released 15 people.
05 July. Members of a Fulani group protested at the Issele-Azagba junction against the killing of a community member the day before. [size=no report]
06 July. Unidentified gunmen attacked Pauwa, Dan Sabo and Makera villages in Kankara LGA. Reports on fatalities range between six and eight. Fatalities coded as six and split between three events.
06 July. Unidentified gunmen attacked Pauwa, Dan Sabo and Makera villages in Kankara LGA. Reports on fatalities range between six and eight. Fatalities coded as six and split between three events.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 06 July. The Nigerian Airforce conducted an airstrike against Boko Haram IS at Bakassi (no coordinates available, in the Lake Chad area). BH structures were destroyed and an undisclosed number of fighters killed. Fatalities coded as 10.
06 July. Unidentified gunmen attacked Pauwa, Dan Sabo and Makera villages in Kankara LGA. Reports on fatalities range between six and eight. Fatalities coded as six and split between three events.
07 July (or around). NAF conducted an operation against militias and encountered a group of gunmen in Kuyelo. 13 abducted people were freed and one gunman was killed in the battle.
07 July (or around). Suspected Fulani militias attacked an orphanage in Issele-Uku, and destroyed parts of the building and a car.
07 July. Unidentified assailants attacked a church in Aguleri. The priest and two other civilians were injured by machetes.

07 July. Three Fulani were detained by a group of angry villagers in Irese. The victims were accused of being involved in recent attacks on the community. They were later handed over to NAF. [size=no report]

07 July. Police forces were on their way to respond to attacks on villages in Kankara when they were ambushed by unidentified gunmen. The battle in Dan-Sabo community led to one police officer killed and an undisclosed number of gunmen killed, in addition to four injured police officers. Fatalities coded as 11.
08 July. Ad-hoc workers of the Lagos State Emergency Management Agency protested their dismissal in Alausa. [size=33]

08 July. A suspected thief in Badore, Lagos was lynched to death by a mob and later thrown into a lagoon. It later turned out that the robbery allegations against the victim were false. [size=no report]

column9: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees; Labour Group (Nigeria)
column17: 08 July. A suspected political militia attacked a meeting of NULGE at their HQ in Okehi.
08 July. Protesters marched to the a church in Loburo and urged their priest to speak on the government's RUGA settlement project. [size=no report]
08 July. APC supporters of Kogi Governor Bello stormed the parties HQ in Abuja to prevent an anti-Bello protest. Journalists were attacked by the APC demonstrators. [size=no report]
08 July. About 50 unidentified gunmen attacked Irina community on July 8 and 9. Five residents were killed. Fatalities split between two events.
07 September. Youth in Kano protested xenophobic violence against Nigerians in South Africa. [size=no report]
09 July. Youth of Nkpolu community and Police forces clashed during a burial in the village. Three people were killed.

09 July. A demonstration of the Islamic Movement at the National Assembly in Abuja turned violent, when IM members reportedly shot and injured two officers- according to government sources. However, IM has denied the shooting, and reported that two IM members were shot and killed by police. 40 IM members were arrested. Neither the government's claim nor, the IM report have been independently verified.
07 September. Tricycle operators in Abuja protested the death of their colleagues in an accident earlier that day. [size=no report]
09 July. About 50 unidentified gunmen attacked Irina community on July 8 and 9. Five residents were killed. Fatalities split between two events.
10 July. Tsar and Obudu communities clashed in the area around the communities. Five youth were killed and property destroyed.
10 July. Protesters gathered in Abuja to express their discontent with Kogi governor Bello and his plans for re-election. [size=no report]
10 July (or around). Residents of Fanibi in Akure city protested blackouts in their area caused by the Benin Electricity Distribution Company. [size=no report]
10 July. Residents of Asaba protested the poor service delivered by the Benin Electricity Distribution Company (BEDC). [size=no report]
10 July. The permanent secretary at the Ministry of Mineral Resources of Adamawa state was kidnapped from his home in Jimeta by unknown gunmen.
10 July (or around). Unidentified gunmen killed four people in the Murbai community.
On 11 July 2019, IM members protested the arrest of their leader in Lagos. [size=no report]
11 July. Workers gathered at the Ecobank HQ in Lagos to protest plans to fire employees. [size=no report]
11 July. Protesters gathered at the Government House in Owerri demanding an investigation on corruption allegations against the Governor. [size=1200]
11 July. IM members protested the arrest of their leader in Kaduna. [size=no report]
11 July. IM members demonstrated demanding the release of their leader in Abuja. The demonstrators clashed with police who responded with tear gas and gunshots to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]
11 July. Residents of Laderin, a village along the Lagos-Ibadan railway, protested in Abeokuta the broken promise by the contractor CCECC to build a bridge across the tracks. [size=no report]
12 July (or around). A communal clash between Ajah and Ilaje militias in Aja led to 10 deaths, several injured residents, and burned houses.
12 July. PDP witnesses in the Presidential Election Petition Tribunal were attacked by unidentified gunmen on their way from Zamfara to Abuja.
13 July. A police officer shot dead a commercial motorcyclist in Ibadan, after reportedly trying to extort the victim.
